Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaD80
Reviews.Content: Lovely spacious room in very pleasant grounds. Staff were all friendly, buffet breakfast was delicious and offered good choice. Complimentary wine tasting on Saturday evening 5.30 to 6.30 and complimentary half bottle of wine and soft drinks in fridge (water and OJ) was a nice touch. We used the fitness suite which was well equipped. Quite a luxurious place, which is reflected in the nightly rate.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A R
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was very disappointed in Harvest Inn. I had emailed the concierge a few times prior to our arrival and finally got a late response and no follow up from her. The room was outdated and had many issues. The fridge didn't work, the shower curtain leaked through onto the floor. Maid service didn't happen unless we called a few times for them to come. The location is great but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Little oasis”
Reviews.Author: Jenny_Big_Sur
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on business - beautiful! Would be willing to spend my own money to stay here again. Wooded/landscaped grounds are inviting, and separate the different areas so that you have a real country feel. Rooms are large and bathrooms huge. Welcoming 1/2 bottle of wine at no charge, along with bottles of water each day, again free. Newspapers - free! Breakfast is included. Coffee, juices, fresh fruit, muffins/pastries, oatmeal with assorted toppings, muffins/toast and a quiche. There was also a selection of cheese and sausage. And it was included. Umbrellas all over the place, which was great as it kept raining on us. The meeting room was on the top floor, with a fireplace and views out over a vineyard. We turned the table around to face the view, and managed to still get our work done. Help is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great place -- even in the rain!”
Reviews.Author: Winterblac
Reviews.Content: We choose Harvest inn for a destination birthday celebration in wine country. Over half the group (8 of us) stayed at HI and everyone felt the place was perfect for our needs. The service is wonderful, and the rooms (we were in Fountain Kings) were spacious, comfortable and charming. The fireplaces got a lot of use because our weather was a bit cold and rainy! We held a wine and cheese party in The Wine Bar for the birthday girl, which everyone enjoyed. Kudos to Cheryl the bartender who managed to keep up with us and keep our group happy. We will definitely pick The Harvest Inn next time we are in Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in a Real Life Thomas Kinkade Painting!!!!”
Reviews.Author: smignogna
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt the most quaint, relaxing, unique place to stay in all of Wine Country. The Harvest Inn is liked you were placed in a Thomas Kinkade Painting. There are cobblestone walkways throughout the entire property. There are big brick fireplaces with wood ready to burn in every room. Our room had a deck overlooking the vineyards and mountains with a hot tub perfect for 2! The breakfast is a wonderful touch. The grounds are impeccable with thousands of freshly planted tulips, roses, and other fresh flowers. The rooms are HUGE and the location is perfect to visit the wineries of St. Helena and Calistoga. Be sure to visit the 3 Castles of Calistoga! There is no shortage of food as there are unreal lunch spots nearby (V. Sattui, Gotts Roadside, Dean and Delucca), as well as unreal restaurants to choose from (Brassica, Market, Press, Bottega, Redd, Bistro Jeanty). The hotel isn't cheap, but is certainly worth it if you are looking for a place to relax, unwind, and drift away into an English Village on the countryside! Talk about comfy cozy, wow!

Reviews.Title: “center located, cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chiara_Corelone
Reviews.Content: I stayed two night while I was visiting Napa for my wine tour It was very center located we can go around visited vineyards and back to hotel. The surrending is very green and good service. Will love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to a return visit”
Reviews.Author: Jen R
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate to have a business meeting at the Harvest Inn. This meant an overnight stay. The grounds were beautiful and the rooms had a very romantic feel. With a sunk in bath tub, a stone and glass shower, a fireplace; it will be a destination spot for my husband and I. The breakfast room, tucked in the back of the facility required that you walk through the beautiful grounds. The breakfast was a well rounded offering. The meeting room although small fit our group perfectly. The staff was extremely helpful and very pleasant. I look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “In The Heart of Napa Valley Action”
Reviews.Author: KTB0929
Reviews.Content: This Inn is not your average Inn or B&B. It's large, the staff is friendly, the rooms oversized and vintage in an old-world kind of way. I had a fireplace in my room - yeah, a real one - where they set up everything for you to light a fire and enjoy the cool Napa nights. The view at the back of the property is a vineyard and the staff is very friendly! Breakfast is included in the room rate and it's delish! The great thing about this property is the location. You are close to some great wineries so driving is minimal. The property is landscaped beautifully and it's far enough off the street that traffic does not seem to be an issue. They do have a lounge area behind the registration with a wine bar - I suggest relaxing here for while! I would certainly consider staying here again in the future. Truly a great place!

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: jean m
Reviews.Content: My husband and i spent a week there earlier in March. THe room was lovely, the grounds are beautiful and the staff couldn't have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to take a break!”
Reviews.Author: Izzy2112
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I just spent five days at the Harvest Inn, and we can't wait to go back. Everyone was friendly and helpful, the rooms were great, the breakfast excellent (and much more than we expected), and the inn's location makes it both relaxing and practical. We all had a massage and just had to laugh when we all proclaimed that "our" therapist was the best ever! The grounds are beautiful as well. The Harvest Inn is now one of my favorites and the place to stay in Wine Country!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it.......”
Reviews.Author: myckyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 girlfriends for 3 nights last week. It was very rustic, quaint and pretty. We loved the breakfast, the lounge area with fireplace and cushy chairs, the grounds are beautiful. Antonello at the front desk was so helpful with everything!! He helped us ship a bunch of stuff home which saved us time from going somewhere to have it shipped. He was so helpful we cannot say enough nice things about him. It was a lovely stay and we would definitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensively nice”
Reviews.Author: Anibal_00
Reviews.Content: The place is very nice, rooms are big but perhaps a bit outdated. Considering the price, you would expect more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Property in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: madcowboy360
Reviews.Content: The Harvest Inn is a fantastic property located outside St. Helena at the northern end of Napa Valley. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and the property backs up to an extensive vineyard with great views. There are various types of buildings, two pools, hot tube, exercise room, breakfast building, among others. The vineyard view rooms are very private and back up to the vineyard at the back of the property. The rooms have huge wood burning fireplaces and you have all the wood you will ever need. These rooms are spacious and have nicely tiled walk in showers,separate tube, and double vanity. I do, however, agree with a prior reviewer that for the price, the rooms and property don't offer a good value. At this price point you do expect more personal service. It's all self parking and there's no one to help with the luggage (and the walk from the car to the room can be quite long). A few other rather minor points worth mentioning that pertain to expectations: First, they don't replenish the bath products even when you stay multiple nights. We didn't get new bath soaps or hair products the entire stay. Second, they place a bottle of wine (375 mL) in the room but then charge you $15 for it upon check out. And third, they have a managers reception on Thursdays with complimentary cheese and crackers but no complimentary wine or other drinks (even sodas!). These three behaviors just don't seem to go with a property at this price point. I've stayed at many other chain hotels at much lower price points that have manager receptions with complimentary drinks. These are just not things I would have expected at this price point. They do provide two bottles of water at the evening turn down service and an ample breakfast is provide each morning in a separate building.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: _JB2SanDiego_
Reviews.Content: This Inn is in the middle of the Napa wine country right on the main route, but tucked back in a beautiful setting, with easy access to everything. Wonderful restaurants are within a mile. Rooms are comfortable with fireplace and a nice soaking tub. Beds were comfortable, but the comforters on the bed were too thick and heavy. Had to keep the room cold or throw it off and be left with just a sheet. Breakfast room was large and comfortable, overlooking the vineyard. They served oatmeal, quiche, and lots of delicious pastries. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Coxbergeron
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harvest Inn for 1 night and wished we could have stayed longer! The location was the perfect middle ground in Napa Valley with so many great wineries nearby. Local restaurants were also amazing. The hotel inn was very clean and I was very impressed with the clean, spacious and recently updated bathrooms. Having a sitting area outside each room, a bottle of wine waiting when you checked in and fireplaces in each suite, the accommodations were terrific. The grounds were beautiful and well kept, and multiple hot tubs and heated pools. Complimentary breakfast was appreciated and offered great views of a vineyard. Staff was extremely friendly! Our only improvement suggestion would be to offer a shuttle or car service for heading to local restaurants in the evenings as there wasn't a full service restaurant onsite.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Esther M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our anniversary and my birthday weekend on March 2nd. 3rd. and 4th. at the Harvest Inn in St. Helena, CA. It was truly one of the nicest places we have been to, and we have traveled extensively. It was charming from the moment you entered the driveway. It was like being in Shangri La. The entire staff were fantastic, friendly and always willing to go the extra mile. Congratulations on your dazzling customer service. Everyone made us feel so special. We had a beautiful room that overlooked the vineyards with a jacuzzi on the deck. We just relaxed and unwound. We went to two great restaurants. One was Tra Vigne in St. Helena and the other was Bistro Jeanty in Yountville. Both had great atmospheres and delicious food. We had lunch at Hurley's in Yountville, which was fun. It was funky and had a great outdoor patio. We will certainly return to this lovely spot. We hated to leave and get back to reality.The fountains and gardens create such a peaceful environment. Great for the body and soul! Harvest Inn has become one of our favorite places. Same time, next year!!!! Esther & Jerry Moran

Reviews.Title: “on beyonce and scenery”
Reviews.Author: vball63
Reviews.Content: Very thankful for this place, my sister and her best friend as well as myself had a wonderful time. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Vjeanne
Reviews.Content: This was a very special trip for my girlfriend and I that haven't seen each other in 27 years. Your staff is incredible, friendly and helpful along with knowledgable of the area. Such a beautiful and peaceful place that offers all the comforts of home.

Reviews.Title: “Down to Earth Mini Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Andrea L
Reviews.Content: I don't have the same view as most of the reviews. I won a contest and staying at Harvest Inn was part of the winnings. So coming from the view of free, I thought it was beautiful. I love simplicity and enjoyed the knowledge of those keeping things running. I had not one single issue come up. The key card worked first time everytime. The food for the free breakfast was great for the majority of eating preferences and with me being a Vegan that is one of the toughest. All these small things added up to a great experience. I stayed in one of the rooms along the vineyard. What a great view each morning and evening! The advice they gave as to which Winery to visit they gave perfect advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax and unwind”
Reviews.Author: 1percentkids
Reviews.Content: We always get a natural wood buring fireplace room on the vineyard, very relaxing. Beds are comfortable, view is good and the place is very quiet. My wife loves this place to relax and get away from the kids. We just come to relax and hit the great resturants nearby; Press, Buchon, FL, etc.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best yet!”
Reviews.Author: mringenoldus
Reviews.Content: We travel pretty extensively - and have stayed in some very nice places....but the Havest Inn is exceptional! The buildings and grounds are perfect for the Napa Valley setting. The concierge offered recommendations for restaurants and wineries for us to consider - and she was spot on. All staff members are friendly and gracious. The rooms are very attractive and the bed is like being on a cloud! The breakfast provided would be hearty enough for even the biggest eater and really delicious. I can only imagine the hours of labor it must take to plant and maintain such beautiful grounds. The hospitality was unfailing - and even as we left we were offered a bottle of water for our trip home. Don't miss an opportunity to stay at this wonderful property!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in a Vineyard...”
Reviews.Author: Carley_12
Reviews.Content: Nothing more surprising than an oasis "on the beaten path". The Harvest Inn is a mini oasis smack in the middle of winery row. The property is hidden behind tall pine trees and backs up to beautiful vineyards and views of the mountains. The rooms are tastefully decorated and large with enough comforts to stay in and relax after a long day of tasting and touring. The staff is incredibly warm and engaging, making sure guest needs are taken care of without being intrusive. I was there for a business meeting, but would definitely come back for a romantic weekend. I've stayed in many establishments in and around Napa Valley, and this ranks as one for the top of the list.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: DandSinNV
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a beautiful two nights at the Harvest INN in S. Helena. Wow, what an experience. Located just south of St. Helena (about 15 miles north of Napa) this is the ideal wine country destination. The grounds, room and spa were immaculate. I myself am not usually one who likes to splurge on hotels, but this place is worth it. Having found a deal on Priceline, the $270 a night was well worth it. The free breakfast was perfect, plentiful and like everything else at the Harvest Inn, first class. The rooms were large, with fire place, soaking tub and walk in shower. We can even attest to the perfection of the two hot tubs that provided a great ending to each day. The free wi-fi, free wine tasting and cheese pairing (Fri./Sat.) along with the free water, orange juice and sparkling water in the room made every nickle worth it. Also, the location allows you so much extra time, without having to fight your way up or back down the valley to get to Napa itself. The restaurants, people and St. Helena itself are perfection. There is no risk in spending the money for this place, and if you have it or are looking to splurge, have no worries . . THIS IS THE PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mshtx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December over our holiday break with two teenagers, which was difficult to find a place to hold four people. The Harvest Inn was the perfect place for our family - large room with fireplace and outdoor hottub. We could roll out couch for our son and they brought in a air mattress for our daughter.... we still had plenty of space. Lovely bathroom with Aveda products. Breakfast was complimentary and was decicious each morning. Great location in the St. Helena area, close to favorite wineries. Close to Gott's Roadside restaurant which is a favorite our ours and is wonderful for kids! Concierge was MOST helpful and made all of our dinner reservations and sent us to our favorite winery of the trip - Fleury Family - so do make use of her expertise and guidance. It was a perfect stay! Would definitely stay here again! Beautiful surroundings with a winery view out our door and huge Redwoods on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful inn with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ddwj
Reviews.Content: We spent a quick weekend in Napa Valley last November and the Harvest Inn was great. The rooms were very comfortable with great amenities. Our room had a fireplace that we throughly enjoyed. There were nightly wine tastings in the main lobby that were fun as well. The daily breakfast was outstanding with an extensive array of choices. Since our trip was so short, I called the concierge prior to our arrival and she had arranged the entire day for us including a private winery tour with a driver. We visited some of the smaller boutique wineries and had an outstanding experience. She also arranged all of our dinner reservations. When I return to St. Helena I will definitely be staying at The Harvest Inn.

Reviews.Title: “So Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Shirley D
Reviews.Content: This is about the most outstanding Hotel experience anyone would want. Great service beautiful accommodations and grounds ever!! We LOVED it, and so would ANYONE.!! The Robert Doumitts

Reviews.Title: “Truly Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: RaychelC30
Reviews.Content: I drove to St. Helena for only one night as I had an appointment in town the next day, so I arrived tired afer a long drive from Los Angeles, and by myself. The property was beautiful and very well-kept, and my room was great. I loved the decor, and it had all the usual perks of a good room. Everything seems recently updated, and is very clean and comfortable. Their hot tub is large, extremely clean, and open 24 hours. You can't beat that. I had a nice little soak by myself before returning to my room for the night, and it was just a very relaxing stay. It was quiet and peaceful, and I wasn't disturbed in the slightest by anything. When the sun came up, it was even prettier since I could actually see all the landscaping.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful and cozy stay in the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I have stayed in many world-class hotels and the Harvest Inn was one of our favorites. The room was absolutely beautiful - from the oversized fireplace to the gorgeous napa area photographs, we felt we never wanted to leave. But the staff was so helpful in guiding us to the best wineries, we couldn't have enjoyed ourselves more. I

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations,great location,incredibly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Eraykimsey
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful room with a vineyard view and fireplace. The staff guided us to 5 great wineries and two great restaurants. The breakfast was superb and the wine bar attendant was very helpful. The Inn made a rainy January weekend something special.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: GraceEllen
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to stay at this beautiful Inn 3 times since September 2011. I have had 3 different types of rooms, all great! The best part of the experience is the staff, such as Antonello, Juan, and MANY others. They are the heart of this place and you will be greeted and served as family. You will be the focus, and no request is too great. Everyone has a great attitude, seems happy to be at their jobs, and they work as a team. My next stay will be in June 2012. I can assure you, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Triple-A Service”
Reviews.Author: Dehron H
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the Harvest Inn was incredibly helpful and polite. Even the person behind the desk at 2am was cheerful! It is rare to find a place with service like this.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at Harvest Inn”
Reviews.Author: zpalanpur
Reviews.Content: We visited Napa and stayed at the Harvest Inn to celebrate my wife's birthday. Its a lovely little hotel and I'd strongly recommend it. We had a good feeling about the place even prior to getting there as the staff we spoke to were so friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay - everything from the beautiful grounds, cozy atmosphere to the large and comfortable rooms with the big fireplace and fabulous location. You are right by the vineyards and our room overlooked them with the mountains as the backdrop. You really feel like you are in the midst of the wine country. The breakfast was very good and the staff is great there. We really enjoyed our stay and hope we can visit sometime in the future again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and beauty”
Reviews.Author: milesart
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Napa and we splurged a bit on the Harvest Inn. We had our 2 teenage daughters so opted for a suite with a fold out queen sized sofa. Our bed was a king, so comfortable with wonderful sheets and pillows. The grounds are beautiful. There are multiple one and 2 story buildings with beautiful imaginative grounds. One of my daughters said it looks like Lothlorian (a Lord of the Rings reference). The breakfast is plentiful and delicious with a view of vineyards and mountains and a patio for warmer weather. We did didn't try the fireplace but they do provide an easy to use bag of logs which is a lovely idea.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: texaslisa
Reviews.Content: We had an upstairs room with a fireplace. Spacious and very comfortable to just lounge around. The recommendations and service from the front desk staff was fantastic. The property is quiet and soothing. The bed linens were exceptionally comfy and sleep quality to die for. Large walk-in shower. The room is spotless. Great location for exploring the upper Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Antartic Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dan M
Reviews.Content: This was an ordinary hotel with large rooms, if you were lucky to get one. But at $350 you get the smallest room available. What surprised me the most is the tight rein they keep on the thermostat. They have a motion controller in the rooms and when you stop moving, that is when you go out to eat, it turns the heat off. Welcome back to a cold room, and keep waiting for the thermostat to catch up with the heat. It takes a long time, the rooms stay as cold as 65 deg. Fahr. Not cool! They moved us to 3 different rooms, and they all got cold as soon as we left the room. I have never been to a hotel where they turn off your heat. This was a big shock to us!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: Hwy1n1Camaro
Reviews.Content: I have been lucky enough to stay here with my fiancée a couple times. The service is amazing here- I was early for check in the first time and they gave me coupons for complimentary tasting at V. Sattui, pretty much across the street. Killer wine by the way. The rooms were both super clean, had fridges, beautiful bathrooms with stone tile showers, recent TVs and great service bringing ice to my door. The beds were unbelievably comfortable with pillows galore! Beautiful room, terrace, and property! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Made our first visit to Napa memorable!”
Reviews.Author: angelbabee
Reviews.Content: Top to bottom the Harvest Inn exceeded every expectation. Their attention to detail from accommodating our endless requests for more firewood (hey we are New Yorkers it was awesome) to the wonderful breakfast every day was amazing. The grounds were immaculate. Spa services were fantastic. The Harvest Inn has earned themselves yearly guests. They certainly made our anniversary special. Noteworthy mentions -Use A Limo Excursions for tastings, Brian and his wife Cinnamon got us into the best tastings! They put a personal yet fun spin on sightseing. We never would have enjoyed as much as we did without his contacts. Special Thanks to Ron at Kelham, Bob, Ann & Jason at Turnesol and the team at Bottega. The education you provided and the passion you exhibited in your winemaking blew us away. Not only can we not wait to come back but we will never feel the same about wine again. Thank you all and see you in August hehehe

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Nikiesq
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Nov for 4 days and the Harvest Inn didn't disappoint. The location was very convenient to vineyards and restaurants. The vineyard rooms were absolutely perfect and I highly recommend you splurge on the extra costs. Service was impecable and everyone was so nice. We left to go to the Ritz in San Fran and found ourselves wanting to be back in this slice of heaven! This Inn is one of my favorite and I can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “A vacation all by itself!”
Reviews.Author: Marianne H
Reviews.Content: Wow!  Just returned from the Harvest Inn.  The most delightful Inn we've stayed at anywhere, period!  Incredible grounds, exceptional service and a staff that seemed truly dedicated to their work.  Our room was great, with a marvelous view of the vineyards and mountains.  Amazing wood burning fireplace that was so romantic.  The breakfast was so good too...not in any way, shape or form, your typical hotel breakfast (I had quiche, croissant, pineapple and granny smith apple with brie...so yummy!).  They even had lovely picnic baskets for us to use for a midday picnic.  Brandon gave us a great tour of the grounds and he was great.  We learned a lot about the history of the hotel as well as the absolutely gorgeous plants and trees that cover the grounds.  Honestly, save for dinner, we had little reason to leave when you consider the room, the spa, the pool, the breakfast, the view and the wine room.  It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room with a view”
Reviews.Author: 60713LindaMarie
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed this past weekend at the beautiful Harvest Inn. From the time you drive up you get the sense of being far away with the trees, vineyard and inviting Inn. The Inn was dressed for the holiday season and it just added to the atmosphere. Highly recommend getting a room that faces the vineyard- they are amazing! Roomy, comfortable bed and beautiful linens. We put the fire on and enjoyed our champagne just after arriving. Doors open out to a patio to enjoy the expansive view of the vines. The breakfast as also really nice! Warm tasty quiche, eggs, cheeses, fruit, cereal warm and cold, and all the breakfast drinks. The staff at every level put their best foot forward to ensure you were happy, comfortable and satisfied. I can't say enough about the service. I highly recommend Harvest Inn- fabulous location to the best restaurants and town. Wonderful for couples, girlfriend getaways, or work (if you have to :-).

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: WeekdaySkier
Reviews.Content: On main road in St Helena. Very nice. Stayed in a suite. Firewood brought to your door, snacks and water included, in room massages. Oakville nearby, Dean and Deluca, Yountville 10 miles south for all you foodies out there. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: tskobo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the advice of a friend for a four night stay this past June. My girlfriend and I were looking for a truly beautiful location in the heart of Napa Valley where we could relax; we were also looking for friendly staff who made you feel at home rather than a modern resort with "see and be seen" clientele. Well Harvest Inn was the perfect choice. We booked a Vineyard Spa Suite and it did not disappoint. Beautifully huge yet rustic fireplace was perfectly situated in the corner of the room alongside our couch and table. Stained glass windows led out on to our own private deck with jacuzzi. The bed was very comfortable and the A/C was good and strong. The bathroom too with his/her sinks were spacious and relaxing. Staff was all too helpful in recommending restaurants, room service with Champagne, wine, etc. Soon after we arrived, we asked that a large umbrella be brought to our private deck (with views of vineyards and mountains in background) and the staff was johnny on the spot! Within minutes we were sitting in the shade, sipping delicious wine and taking in the view. Though no restaurant, the complimentary breakfast was excellent! Will definitely go back and have already been recommending this place to others

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spot and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Hedgeclipperz
Reviews.Content: We were there for four days in early December. We had an issue with our toilet and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. They were wonderfully friendly upon registration and got our bags to our room as we arrived before the room was available. We had a nice bottle of wine, water and fruit waiting for us. The room and bathroom were great. Breakfast was terrific and varied. Sitting around the large fire having a glass of wine with our traveling companions in the great room was fun and the bartender fun to chat with. The location is very convenient. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday weekend of my life”
Reviews.Author: Sasha0973
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me for a romantic weekend getaway. Lisa, the concierge, was truly amazing in helping to arrange the details. Our 3 hour couples spa treatment with Cece and Sarniee was unforgettable. Having enjoyed many couples spa treatments, this was by far the best ever. We definitely had the A team! Our room in the Manor was gorgeous, warm and the views were spectacular. The two nights we were there went fast and we are already planning our return.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway in Napa”
Reviews.Author: jjnorm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harvest Inn the last two nights. We are on a business trip that turned into a romantic getaway. From the moment we arrived and were welcomed by the friendly staff we have had a fantastic time. The rooms are lovely. We are in a fountain view room which has a larger bathroom and a huge bathtub and seperate shower. There is a gas fireplace that we turned on and heated the room. Some of the other rooms have woodburing fireplaces, but we prefer the ease of the on off switch and the magic of a fire appearing immediately. The rooms are great and are nicely furnished. The beds are comfortable. Behind the hotel is a vineyard which is a perfect backdrop when you are sitting in the country kitchen restaurant and enjoying a very nice breakfast. The hotel is located right off of Hwy 29 and I thought the highway noise might bother me but we didn't hear any noise in our room or even while walking the grounds. For the holidays, the hotel is decorated with Chirstmas decorations. On Friday and Saturday nights, 5:30-6:30pm, they offer complimentary wine and cheese tasting. On Thursday they offer complimentary cheese and a discount on wine for the General Manager's party, although the General Manager did not show up so I think that they should rename the evening to the Harvest Inn Welcome party. They offer free WIFI in the rooms and complimentary use of a computer in the lobby. Great staff including the Concierge, front desk, bartender, and Nadar who was very helpful. I would highly recommend The Harvest Inn. The location is perfect, only one mile from St Helena and close to many wonderful restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Getaway Property!”
Reviews.Author: Stacy M
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband had booked Harvest Inn for Thanksgiving to get away from family this year, and I must say that we had made the best decision ever!. We were even able to book spa treatments on Thanksgiving morning and everyone on staff was so friendly and helpful and warm. Antenello was the best! We will spread the word and the Harvest Inn will be seeing me, my husband and my little doggie Chewy again! Thank you so much for a very relaxing holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Inn”
Reviews.Author: MATeacher0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting family for Thanksgiving and stayed at the Harvest Inn. We had a wonderful experience! Our room was large and clean and the bed was fantastic. The bathroom was large and had recently been renovated. Rooms are spread out throughout the grounds making our room feel very private even though I think the hotel was full. I used the fitness center each morning. We enjoyed the free breakfast which included fresh fruit, yogurt, muffins, scones and croissants, quiche and more overlooking a beautiful vineyard. Everyone who worked there was professional, friendly and went out of their way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A must to make your Napa experience complete”
Reviews.Author: Gerald C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harvest Inn recently and could not have been more pleased. After over 20 years of day trips to wine country, our son set us up at the Harvest Inn for this trip. Rave reviews for the amenities, the spacious room with a fireplace, the convenient location in St. Helena, and most of all the professional friendly staff. We will continue to return to Napa Valley and make the Harvest Inn part of our plans.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay when visiting Napa”
Reviews.Author: Chris L
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Harvest Inn. It was the best experience, we definetly will be returning. The grounds were beautliful, the staff was friendly and accomidated all our needs. We even got a tour from the grounds keeper witch we thought was very nice and helpful. I recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Wine Tasting Adventure”
Reviews.Author: Lucie48887
Reviews.Content: LWe enjoyed our stay at the Harvest Inn. The breakfast in the vineyard was wonderful. It was located in the middle of wine country and we enjoyed visiting many vineyards, The Harvest Inn had beautiful grounds and several lovely swimming pools.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Dunhams
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harvest Inn for 6 days while we attended a boot camp at the Culinary Institute. The property is lovely and feels as if it is more nestled away in the mountains that it is. The location was very convenient for our needs, and although located on the main highway, it was relatively quiet. Our accommodations were clean and well maintained and the personnel were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway!”
Reviews.Author: days612
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to stay at the Harvest Inn. We chose it from other reviews and photos online. It was so much nicer than it looked on their web site. It is many buildings, tucked away amongst lots of trees. What a peaceful place to stay, yet it is close to the all the wineries, shops, and restaurants in St. Helena. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “All that you could need”
Reviews.Author: Barbara H
Reviews.Content: This was our second year staying at the Harvest Inn and we hope to continue to make it part of our annual Napa trip. It is conveniently located, hence the perfect location. The grounds are magnificent, with hidden benches spread throughout, so there are plenty of opportunities to just sit and relax. From the delicious breakfast to the turn down service at night, all your needs are meet at this charming yet luxurious inn. After a long day touring and tasting, it's wonderful to fall asleep next to a roaring fire that, thanks to their set-up, is as easy to start as just lighting a match.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet - Serene - Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain1952
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this week for two nights in conjunction with a scheduled balloon ride in Napa. We had always driven by the Harvest Inn on our trips to the St. Helena-Silverado Trail area. The Inn is centrally located on highway 29 and on our last trip we stopped in to check it out. Were very impressed with the lobby and the grounds which are lush and relaxing. We found the prices continue to drop with the weather changing and November worked out well for us to see the changing of the colors. Also, go during the week to miss the weekend madness and the prices are also less then. Check in was quick and easy- they pre-charged our card for the first night so when we checked out the cost did not seem so bad-- the rooms are pricey ($465 ea with taxes for the vineyard view with the fireplace) but so is everything from Napa north on highway 29! Tip-- be sure to let them know if you are celebrating anything special --- we had our 37th anniversary and they graciously provided a bottle of Chandon bubbly. :) Thank you Harvest Inn! The beds are VERY comforable and down pillows that you can really sink into. We stayed in a unit that backed to the vineyards and also had a fireplace--- they will bring extra wood so you just kick back enjoy the sunset, a bottle of your favorite vintage and feel the warmth from the fire. I would definitely stay here again for a special trip.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some update”
Reviews.Author: elzny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights for a wedding - the place is very quaint - beautiful grounds, friendly staff, great breakfast. But the rooms are a bit old - there are 4 sections - Rose, Manor, Vineyard, Fountain. We stayed at the Rose section. The rooms are little clusters of wood cabins. Most of them are on the ground floor so it feels very humid & stuffy, plus rooms are small & dark. So if you are expecting something like bright sun-filled Caribbean resort rooms, don't come here. You'll feel very depressed. My friend's room's bathroom has ants crawling all over the counter top. Our room has quite a few fruit flies. The bathroom is fairly bright - painted white and with lots of light coming in. Our bathroom is as big as the bedroom - i.e., really small bedroom. No living area except a desk that's 3 ft away from the bed. If you tilt your chair back you will hit the mattress. Also as soon as you open the door, you see the bed. The mattress is like 2 steps away from the front door. So if anyone sitting out in the yard and you open your door, they will see you in your bed. Very stingily laid out floor plan indeed. The walls are very thin, you can hear the next door people talking in their room. Squeaky mattress as well. So if you are planning to come here for honeymoon, think again. Dog friendly though. They have some rooms equipped with dog bed and treats and water/food bowls. But other rooms dogs are not allowed. My friend's wedding suite is big, but also country cabin flavor. So in summary, come here if you just need a place to crash, and don't plan to spend much time in the room. I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Gem”
Reviews.Author: Dutchess2245
Reviews.Content: This inn has it all. The location is so convenient, it's charming, the staff was very accommodating, I can't say enough positive things about the Harvest Inn. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BabyKatcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harvest Inn August 19th for 4 nights while visiting the Napa area. It took me forever to finally book with them as I was considering and researching so many of the resorts. I kept coming back to the Harvest Inn though, and finally decided to book it. We reserved the outdoor spa suite and it was perfect! The pictures do not do this place justice; it's so gorgeous! Right off of the balcony is the vineyard, just a few steps away and you can touch the vines. The breakfast each morning is wonderful; a nice selection of meats, cheeses, a quiche, fresh fruit, amazing english muffins, and more.

Reviews.Title: “St. Helena Charm”
Reviews.Author: Winecanine
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay when you can get a good rate. Tee all you can eat country breakfast is wonderful. The grounds are gorgeous and you are in lovely St. Helena. A great place!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: naomifl73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this place. It has a great location, easy to get to restaurants and wineries. The staff was very nice and helpful. Very beautiful to walk around and has a nice pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay in Napa if you want to get away!”
Reviews.Author: JSKenner
Reviews.Content: Really can't say enough good about this place. My wife and I were overly impressed by the grounds and hospitality of the staff. Beautiful place overall. Great location just a short mile drive from St. Helena. Close to the best run of wineries in Napa. Also plenty of good food/eats nearby. Was hesitant to pay the $300/night as that is usually not my preferred price range. However, can honestly say that they could have charged much for what they provide... Great breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: tenor4u2
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Harvest Inn, and we look forward to our next! Comfortable rooms, bath and patio area...refrigerator was handy...love the breakfast choices and view...but the location is the best reason to stay here. Our favorite wineries and restaurants are minutes away. Dean and Deluca is also very close for lunch and appetizers that we brought to the property.

Reviews.Title: “Vineyard view”
Reviews.Author: brownman6
Reviews.Content: Our room had a direct access to neighboring vineyard with mountain view, picture hanging fog, a wonderful fireplace, great bed, loung chairs, deck chairs. The bath was well appointed and the toiletrees were first class. We enjoyed the hot tub, well equiped exercise room and the two winery sponsored wine tastings in the evening. The breakfast was plentiful, great variety including cheese and salmon and champagne on Sunday. Our only complaints were maids letting in flys when they cleaned and no room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Napa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Msulli2
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times and have always found the property immaculate and well-run. Centrally located and close to the best wineries and restaurants. My wife and I also enjoy the bed and breakfast feel of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Do I have to leave? I can't imagine anyplace better in Napa Valley!”
Reviews.Author: mgc777
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and it was not long enough, that is for sure! The location is great, right in the middle of Napa! The grounds of this resort are immaculate, the room we had which was a Vineyard View was incredible. We were within 5 minutes of some of the finest restaurants in the area and we hit 4 out of 5 of the top in St Helena! We are already planning our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible....like a dream!!”
Reviews.Author: Ev4
Reviews.Content: I loved the Harvest Inn. It was so expensive, but you really get what you pay for. The grounds are lovely, and the rooms are gorgeous and kept very clean. I booked a massage with Cece, who was amazing, kind, and wonderful. We had breakfast a couple of times when we stayed and the room overlooked the vineyard--the view was breathtaking! The pool and hot tub were a lot of fun. We couldn't bring glasses by the pool area (understandably) so we brought plastic cups and had our own little party. It was April so it was still pretty cool outside but the pool is heated so it wasn't bad. Our first night there we went to the hotel bar and spoke with Antonello, who is incredibly nice and an amazing person!! Staying here was really ilke being in a dream. The decor is gorgeous and there is this delicious smell in the air, like a fireplace, that just makes it cozy and romantic. If I ever have the money again I would absolutely 100% stay here again!!! I'm sure its gorgeous anytime of the year.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: margojo
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Harvest Hotel on August 6 to be told we had no reservations...our reservation was for September. Okay I thought I have royally goofed up except I spoke to someone at the hotel on July 31 after reading your reviews concerning this property 1. over the use of room fresheners and 2. checking to make sure we did not have a room by the pool. Now keep in mind I had reserved 3 rooms for my 80 year old Mom , my 20 year old children and myself. We were in St. Helena for a family wedding. All the guest were staying at this property and that is why I chose to stay here. The young woman I spoke to one the 31st confirmed I was coming and would remove all room fresheners and understood my concerns. I even received a follow up call at my home stating all was taken care of. You must imagine my surprise when the desk clerk could not even find my name....... I was then informed by the manager that they were full except for 1 room that was a queen. I was also told St. Helena was sold out of all rooms except maybe the Whitehall Inn that is nothing like this property..ummmm did that mean it was a dive. I ask if they would please call Meadow Wood to see if they had rooms...this was when things began to improve greatly. The young woman on the phone was so kind and helpful I could have weep. We were able to secure 2 beautiful rooms at their sister property the Inn at Stonebridge. The manager and staff of the Harvest Inn were the most UNHELPFUL IN DIRE SITUATION. I stopped at the desk repeatedly to get receipt showing I had been refunded my deposit and never was able to get confirmation. It was refunded but with no help form the desk. Oh when told I could have one room with a queen for the siblings ( one boy and one girl) and they would give me a blow up mattress- then the manager corrected the clerk and said we could have a rollup for free. Finally after asking they help us out please they said they could give me the room for 199.00 Needless to say we declined their lack of help...I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL...AWFUL AWFUL EXPERIENCE. Stay at the Inn at Southbridge- it was the most enjoyable time...so friendly and the property was beautiful.at the Inn at Stonebridge... oh the dead planters of geraniums on the patio did help either when joining our wedding group for wine tasting.

Reviews.Title: “such a lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nadabel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely lovely, the grounds, the breakfast, the rooms, the location, but it is the service that makes the place exceptional. Everything they did was designed to make us feel welcome and comfortable in all respects. The staff is knowledgeable about the area, went to great lengths to get us reservations at restaurants, they are low key and yet totally attentive. from housekeeping to the manager, absolutely everyone here made our stay especially enjoyable. Our whole family had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL VINEYARD VIEW AND PRIVATE TERRACE”
Reviews.Author: DFWMartin
Reviews.Content: Waking up and looking out into the vineyard with temperatures in the 50 was heavenly coming from Texas. The room was beautiful, great big fireplace, plenty of room to relax and work if necessary. There was a bottle of wine and glasses waiting for us in the room. The breakfast was more than plenty and sitting outside got the day off to a great start. We then walked right off the patio into the vineyards and strolled around watching the workers trim the grapevines with care. Napa is a great place to stay a few days or a week. I would definitely stay here again! The location is perfect for downtown, vineyards and the entire region.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, tasty breakfast, warm and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: feiners01
Reviews.Content: Even though it's on the main road, the room was quiet and the grounds had a wonderful tranquility. We stayed in a "Fountain King" which was in a newer section and I was a bit disappointed not to be in the more charming, forested area but once inside the room, the disappointment vanished. There was a welcome bottle of wine and we found the room decor to be lovely, especially the large bathroom with a wonderful tub and great bath salts. I would definitely return. The quiche at breakfast was so delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing time”
Reviews.Author: aaron1rosenbaum
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the Hotwire deal (4* St. Helena/Calistoga). I was initially disappointed - I was sure we would be staying at Inn at Southbridge. However, I was very pleasantly surprised and had a great time. We stayed in the fountain rooms. Room 419 was at the corner of the property - probably the closest to the highway. I've done a fair amount of soundproofing professionally and they have done quite a nice job. No sleeping with windows open but with things closed, very little road noise. Room was very nicely laid out. Mattress could have been firmer and pillows were down (allergic) or huge (I should have asked for a different one - they probably would have brought it.) Unlike many small inns, they had decent internet - we were able to use NetFlix in the evening instead of suffering with broadcast TV (they do have some sort of DNS issue they need to resolve....slow DNS.) The breakfast was nice. I liked having a buffet instead of being served. It was the same day-to-day - cheese + sausage, fruit, great pastries, oatmeal, cereal, hard boiled eggs, a quiche, coffee, juice. The main lodge room was very comfortable. We used to hot tub nice - I like that it's open 24 hours. Grounds were very pretty. Location was convenient. Service was friendly and fantastic all the way around. I give the fitness center a 3 compared to all fitness centers but compared to comparable hotels, it's a 5 - other small inns typically don't have anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: candida6752
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this is a very nice property and you will not be disappointed. It is expensive. If you can afford it, you will not regret the investment. My favorite thing is the quiet rooms and the very comfortable beds as well as the garden atmosphere - delightful. But also very important - the service is beyond compare. I was pleasantly greeted by every single staff person I saw and asked if there was anything I needed. And if I had a request, it was taken care of immediately! The people who work here are wonderful. Friendly, professional and caring. It makes all the difference. The continental breakfast was supposed to be a step above but I found it to be pretty ordinary - with the exception of the lattes that could be purchased to go with it. The internet is free and hassle free - thank goodness. I hate hotels that nickel and dime the internet use - you know they are connected so they can process your credit card - but they aren't going to let their guests use it? Seems unnecessarily stingy and this hotel is not stingy in any way. The bath products are really special and nice. The robes are super soft and plush and you'll need one as you wander the large grounds to find one or both of the really nice pools. There are fountains everywhere and lovely little garden spots to sit and read and relax. I loved the roses blooming everywhere - really pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: ltlminidrvr
Reviews.Content: Rooms are extra large and comfortably furnished. Grounds are beautiful. Polite and helpful staff. Breakfast adds value to room rate which is high. We will stay again location, staff and views make it worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING and PERFECT (just like the last 2 times)!!”
Reviews.Author: cgwomble
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect wine country hotel; it will not dissapoint!! Their vineyard view rooms are so relaxing--not to mention spectacular views of the mountains and vineyard. They are always thoughtful and are willing to go the extra mile to make your stay enjoyable and memorable. They even sent us a card thanking us for staying with them again--chocolate too! Anything we needed, we were granted. Their grounds are breathtaking and even if you don't visit any wineries, you would be happy just hanging out there. It is the perfect place for couples and is centered around romance. They have a continental breakfast each morning in the Kountry Kitchen and the spread is fantastic! They have a place to eat breakfast outside and if you are lucky, you can catch the sun rising over the mountains (take a light jacket though because it can be chilly--if you don't sit outside you are missing out!). I have stayed here 3 times now in the past year and I can't wait to book my next trip! Find out which wine clubs they are affilitated with and you may even get a discount off your nightly rate! Also, their pillows feel like you are sleeping on a cloud... perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Pizzyp
Reviews.Content: I don't generally rate hotels this high but I have to say Harvest Inn was perfect for our honeymoon stay. Grounds are beautiful and well designed, kind of an old world feel to the place. Breakfast was served in a cottage house, very warm and cozy. Staff was great and the room was exceptional, plenty of room to lounge. Two pools, are clean and secluded. For the price you get what you expect. This is one Inn where the pictures on the website actually can't capture the ambience of Harvest Inn. St. Helena is a great location, in the middle of Napa wine country, with excellent restaurants nearby. (Cindy's, Tra Vigne)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Gorgeous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NAMRPM
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about The Harvest Inn. the grounds are beautiful. The rooms are great. We stayed in a vineyard spa view. We were right on the vineyard. It was so peaceful and breathtaking. We used the hottub and then would light a fire in the fireplace. This room also comes with a spa treatment which was very nice. There was a nice breakfast served each morning. We got champagne upon arrival and another bottle of wine the next day. Our refrigerator was stocked with juice and water. They do not nickel and dime you here. The staff is incredible. Thanks to Marcus, Lisa and especially Tasha for making our stay so special. It's also in a great location. Near alot of nice vineyards and great restaurants. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there Whenever we can afford it. It is Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: bcrowell
Reviews.Content: Oh so comfortable! Walking to enough wineries to take care of a whole day!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Napa Valley!”
Reviews.Author: pjb75
Reviews.Content: Very quaint , comfortable hotel in a great location! Good service, nice accomodations, friendly staff! We highly recommend this property for a relaxing visit to wine country!

Reviews.Title: “NOISY. OVER RATED”
Reviews.Author: Indianaman
Reviews.Content: Over rated for such an expensive place. For the price of rooms you would expect immaculate grounds and pristine surroundings like a four seasons. But this place is average at best At one point while trying to relax Someone started pounding on the door . "Room Service.. Room service.." I had answer the door and let them know I didn't order room service. The person insisted I did and said aren't you Mr. X. No I'm not. "oh, they said" I was placed near the pool. At most high end places the pool is quiet , serene and relaxing NOT HERE. The pool is open 24 hours. Mistake. At 11pm the party started. Yelling, Wooping., Laughing. I could hear conversations as if people were in my room. The french lady talking to some guy about a wedding. People laughing so loud it woke me through my closed doors. Finally at 230 I had to call the front desk and ask them to shut down the party.It took a while but finally at 3 the noise dissipated. In the morning I asked to be transferred to another room. I was coldly told " You should have called earlier if it was noisy." They did transfer me to another room. The room reeked of air fresher. Even made me cough at times. Finally found fragrance sticks behind the TV and moved them to the closet. The toilet ran 24 hrs a day like water torture. Grounds were very unruly and Tired.. The Patio outside of the breakfast area was covered with leaves and tree droppings. They tout the breakfast experience. Breakfast was just ok 1 quiche. Over cooked sausage. Some cheese and muffins. Would not recommend the place and would not stay here again. No value here. I would have had a more restful trip at a Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “The GOLD standard for Napa Valley accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: GAndersGardens
Reviews.Content: Wow...Where to start? Location? Hmmm...Perfect. Views? OK...again...perfect. Staff? Over the top. Breakfast? Superb. Grounds? Private and a park-like setting. With a simple call to the front desk we were guided directly to the hotel to almost the exact minute by the desk clerk. Upon arrival we were greeted by name and with a genuine smile...it felt like we were staying with family or old friends! The splendor of the grounds and buildings were absolutely stunning! We arrived to our room to find a card signed by some of the staff and management congratulating us on our anniversary...and what a room! Spacious and well appointed with views that only got better as the sun went down! A leisurely hot tub experience on the patio looking out on the vineyards going into sunset made the romance only stronger! The bed...oh, the bed! Should I call it the cloud? The pillows so soft they seemed to whisper to you. The softness of the sheets...the absolutely wonderful sleep! And breakfast...the fruit all at perfect ripeness. Fresh baked goods (as I understand sourced locally) and fresh juices and coffees. Wonderfully savory fritatta and again, the opportunity to enjoy our breakfast just feet from the vineyards... Had to purchase the robe! Soft and sensuous! We were even thanked by Debbie, the hotel manager, for staying when we were checking out after a leisurely late morning... Will we return? Oh yeah...I can imagine the crisp fall air as the leaves of the vineyards start their colorful riotus explosion in October! 'Hot tub weather in the Napa Valley' in Webster's Dictionary has a picture of our room at The Harvest Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and beautiful accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: karebre
Reviews.Content: We had a leadership retreat with approximately 45 senior staff from our firm attend a 2 day/1 night business event. The Harvest Inn event staff was extremely organized and helpful down to the finest details. The rooms are spectacular and provide a beautiful & calming atmosphere. Meeting arrangements and catering was wonderful & we definately plan on coming back in the future! Thanks Harvest Inn!

Reviews.Title: “The best 4th of July experience!”
Reviews.Author: Marigator
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful Hotel in Napa Valley. We've stayed here many times before, but our stay this week was the most memorable. We brought a couple from Florida here to finalize the purchase of their company by our local company. The rooms are amazing, with every amenity you can imagine. Wonderful beds, stone fireplaces, sitting area, dining area,large bathrooms with good separation and private patios with a chaise lounge, chairs and table. All of the employees were attentive, professional and went above and beyond to ensure a pleasant stay. The woman at the front desk made all our dinner reservations and even suggested a wonderful place we hadn't tried yet. The most amazing 4th of July fireworks display is put on by the Martini Vineyards right across the street from the hotel. Employees from the Harvest Inn set up chairs for the guests at the edge of the property and provide security during the show. We've watched fireworks shows all over the world and this was by far the best. We will be back next year to enjoy 4th of July in the wine country.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing Stay - Not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Paco1paco
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the harvest inn for a short 3 day stint in wine country. Setting was very quaint but almost completely out of the action. Would recommend staying in yountville over this location hands down since you drive/bus to all the ineries anyway. Need to drive to restaurants ect where other locations you can walk across the street and find some great restaurants & atmosphere. Beware of second story units if you are over 5 ft 1 in height....let alone if you are 6"2. Even at $460 a night there are some terrible rooms that are not remotely representative of this pricing point. Place was clean and fairly quiet. Train does go by from time to time. Pools were a little old and tired. Breakfast in the morning was good but overall would definetly not stay again. Plenty of other communities close by that offer a better overall setting.

Reviews.Title: “Best Wedding Venue and Consummate Service”
Reviews.Author: jaalan
Reviews.Content: Desirous of a vineyard wedding experience, my daughter and her fiance selected the Harvest Inn. Hands down, this venue and property are replete with all the trimmings and trappings that translate into a magical site. From 2 to 85 our guests enjoyed the park-like setting, the "woodsiness " with statuesque redwoods, beautiful green manor lawn, and grapevines. The newlyweds and overnight guests also were amazed at the supreme level of customer service from all staff . Working more intimately with the event coordinator, Jessica Thornton, I must say the Harvest Inn has a true gem in her and her professionalism!! My experience could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Peace of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: spin4lyf
Reviews.Content: A perfect 4 days in Napa Valley. This hotel is in the heart of St. Helena, which is in close proximity to all you need in Napa. The room was rustic yet elegant. Very clean with housekeeping twice daily. The grounds are gorgeous and serene. The breakfast was over the top (which comes with the room), and they also have a newly added fitness center. It's small, but adequate. Definitely great value for your money. We got a bottle of wine in our room complimentary. Also free WIFI. What can I say....I LOVE this place and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: AmyMcGowen
Reviews.Content: After not liking the original place I was booked at, I was lucky enough to get a room here, and wow!! The location is perfect, the views from my room was amazing... roses and vines!!! The people are so friendly and helpful, the breakfast is very nice and complimentary. And the room is just huge! I've never seen such a huge fireplace! The water pressure in the shower blasts you across the room, in a good way! Large tub, huge bathroom, and great big rooms.... Its all good!!!! Simply perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: maidenvoyager
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here for a mini-break to do some wine tasting in St Helena. The first room we were given was pretty small and had an adjoining door, but after speaking with reception we were given a much nicer room, with a huge bathroom with his and hers sinks. We were very impressed. After a good nights sleep in a comfortable bed, we sampled the complimentary buffet breakfast, which was very good, in particular the quiche. Breakfast is served in a room overlooking the vineyards, and in summer it is possible to sit out on the terrace and soak up the lovely view. We ate out for dinner but enjoyed a couple of glasses of wine in the bar, entertained by the interesting Welsh barman. We would not hesitate to stay here again when in Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Harvest Inn: BEST place to stay in Napa (St. Helena) for a Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Dalferes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently celebrated our 10th anniversary with a trip to Napa and a stay at the Harvest Inn. This hotel is a GEM. From the very moment you enter the beautiful main house to check-in; you will be treated in every way like a special guest. Actually, the superior treatment started before we even arrived with the front desk staff helping us make dinner reservations at local restaurants for the three nights we were in Napa. Speaking of the front desk staff do not hesitate to ask them for advice as to which wineries to visit (special thanks here goes to Tara who helped us every day of our stay). Thanks to their advice AND some very useful vineyard passes we saved quite a bit of money on tasting fees (most were two for one). Two tips here: first, when you visit a winery we learned to always tell them we were sent by Harvest Inn, this helps everyone know they are being promoted (and sometimes even led to further discounts). Second, we learned that many of the wineries offer a military discount: you just have to ask. Special shout-out to Napa Mum for their 2-for-1 tour (making sparkling wine is more interesting than you would think) AND their 30% military discount. If you are going to stay at Harvest Inn, we definitely recommend the vineyard view room with fireplace. It's a beautiful site to wake up to every morning. The Harvest Inn also has a worthy spa; it's not as big or opulent as some of the other spas, but, ask for "Cici" and she will change your world. Also, don't miss breakfast (included in the price of your stay). It's far beyond the standard continental breakfast, offering pastries, quiches, fresh fruit, cheeses, and meats. You'll be sorry if you miss the chocolate croissant.

Reviews.Title: “The most romantic getaway spot in the Napa Valley.”
Reviews.Author: littlelibran
Reviews.Content: This was my most favourite hotel on my entire trip to the US recently. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and I loved the nice touch of the complimentary half bottle of wine. The bathrooms were also spacious and the shower was fantastic - you could have a party in there! I only wish I had been there with my lover....... The gardens and mountain views were outstanding and I would plan a whole trip around the Harvest Inn. The only thing that would have made it perfection would be if they had their own restaurant so everything would be in easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a weekend getaway.”
Reviews.Author: docmonty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently escaped to the Harvest Inn in St. Helena for a weekend getaway. The hotel was perfect. Our room was spacious, clean and quiet with a fireplace, patio overlooking the pool and large flat screen TV. The staff was exceptional, the grounds gorgeous and the bed incredibly comfortable. We went for long bike rides each day on the local backroads and returned for a relaxing soak in the hot tub and lounged by the pool. We were fortunate that the weather was beautiful and enjoyed a downtown street festival the first night, which occurs on the first Friday of each month. There was a free wine tasting with appetizers each night in the great room. The breakfasts (included) had a nice variety and were delicious. We would also highly recommend two local restaurants for dinner, The Market and The Homestead. Both venues had excellent food with pleasant wait-staff and reasonable prices. Thank you Harvest Inn for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return next year...”
Reviews.Author: kz_78
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Harvest Inn. From the staff, to the room and the breakfast each morning, I can't tell you how perfect they made our three days in Napa. We stayed in a Fountain View room, specifically for the soaking tub and we were not disappointed. While the location was not as picturesque as other rooms, we found the room to be clean, spacious and exactly as advertised. I have to mention the turn down service! Each night when we returned from dinner, we had fresh bottles of water on our night stand, a full bucket of ice, a jazz CD playing and a freshly made bed. We thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast, both the food and the view. Despite the fact that it was only in the high 50's, we took our breakfast on the patio each morning. Fresh pastries, fresh fruit, cheese, meats and delicious quiche were among some of the selections. The staff was friendly and helpful. The grounds were beautiful. There were literally hundreds of tulips in bloom and the property was well manicured and the heated pool and hot tub were clean and well maintained. The hotel is very much an English cottage style hotel, yet it still had the feel of a more modern and updated hotel with new flat screen tvs and DVD players in the room. It does not have the feel of a sleek and modern hotel, but that is 100% of its charm. I must also say that Antonello at the front desk was the nicest, helpful hotel employee. It was perfectly located within the valley and very easy to access places both north and south. We will be back next year and would not think of staying anywhere else other than the Harvest inn.

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bdkc1959
Reviews.Content: We went there for our 30th anniversary, and it was GREAT!! The room and the view was amazing. The breakfast was good every morning. The only thing that we were disappointed in was the bathtub it was very small not enough room for 2. This was centrally located in the middle of everything. Would come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: jenncole79
Reviews.Content: My now husband and I were recently married in Napa. We choose Harvest Inn as our hotel for ourselves and our guests. We had a full three days of fun with all of our friends and family. I am beyond thrilled with our decision. The setting was perfect for us to gather for the wonderful breakfast each morning and in the evenings in the beautiful and cozy bar area. The staff, where do I begin?! Everyone went out of their way to ensure that we were all having a great time! I wish I could remember everyones names to call them out here, but truly, everyone was so great. I do have to mention Jessica, who watched over everything for our group, went above and beyond for us many, many times. In our rush to leave for the airport to start our honeymoon, many items were left behind, including a few valuable times...when we called to ask if anything was found, having no idea where they could be, she located everything and shipped it all straight to us. It's just not the service that you receive many places anymore. It's so very appreciated. Thank you, Jessica! PS - If you are thinking about a destination wedding in Napa, feel free to reach out to me as I had some of the best vendors in the area! Harvest Inn also made for some gorgeous pre-wedding photos =)

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Patg_123_4
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Harvest Inn was very enjoyable as the accommodations were excellent, the staff efficient and friendly, and the amenities both unexpected and very nice. One of the few times were a hotel greatly exceeded our expectations. Would highly recommend staying here and plan to do so when we travel to St. Helena again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the middle of the wine district”
Reviews.Author: Rueskov
Reviews.Content: Had a really great stay at the Harvest Inn. Room was a bit dark but really nice with a gas fire place and a huge and very fine bathroom with a big shower and a huge tub. Room had all you could wish from a hotel room (except a cork screw - we had to use our own when opening the complimentary bottle of red wine). Breakfast was included and very good - lots of fruit, quiche, pastries, cheeses, sausages, bread, cereal, oat meal etc. Staff was very helpful and we got a lot of wine tasting passes for wineries in the neighborhood. A complimentary bottle of water was put on the bed side table when making the room ready for the night and we had another couple of bottles upon check out - for the road. We did not use the outdoor pool as it was raining but the water seemed to be hot enough though. The hotel has a beautiful garden and good views of wine fields and mountains from some rooms (including the breakfast room). Even though it is located at the main street through Napa Valley the hotel felt very quiet. Many restaurants are so close that you can actually walk it. The Harvest Inn is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: ARGIGGLES
Reviews.Content: The location in the heart of St Helena was great. If you are in Napa Valley for wine tasting, the Harvest Inn is the best place to stay. My husband and I were celebrating our 10th anniversary and my husbands being home from a deployment and the hotel staff made our visit awesome. The bottle of Champagne and Chocolates left in our room on our arrival day was so special. Our room had the natural fireplace which the stafff cleaned out daily and ensured we could have a fire each night. The room was spacious with a beautiful view of the vineyards and hills. The breakfast was ok, not a lot of variety each day, but we were not there for the food. Overall when we return to the Napa Valley we will definately stay at the Harvest Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CrossRoads43
Reviews.Content: Great value all around. Can't go wrong. Rooms are BIG. Very few shared walls - kind of bungalow style. Lots of privacy. Lots of amenities for no extra cost. Very unique setting you won't experience elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay, but......”
Reviews.Author: wineisgreat
Reviews.Content: First of all, the grounds were very beautiful and well kept and we ended up enjoying our stay despite a few setbacks that could have been brought to our attention before booking. When I called to book our King Fireplace room, the staff led me to believe it had a large tub, which we were excited about using. It did not! Our room was also located right next to a wedding reception that was going on that night. No one told us anything about it, either while booking the room or checking in. My husband and I don't get away much and were looking forward to a good rest, so we were very dissapointed. We called to see if they could move us to another room and they were able to move us across the grounds. When we entered the room, no tub at all! Very upsetting because once again, they did not inform us of this and we were looking forward to what we had paid for! To top it all off, we decided to use the outdoor spa by our room and it was closed for repairs! Once again, no mention of this by the staff! I feel that had we known all of these things ahead of time, we may have booked a different weekend, or not at all. On a positive note, the fireplace and the beds were amazing! Very comfortable! Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at it's BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Carmelsteve
Reviews.Content: If you haven't read the review below by " Mrs.G", don't wast your time. It is clear that woman was clueless and had some sort of personal axe to grind! It's too bad that a review like that might cause someone to miss out on an incredible couple of days like my wife and I just experienced! We have been coming to the Napa Valley for far too many years to count, both as leisure and as working trips. We are both make our living in the hospitality industry, so trust me, we understand "Hospitality". Our pleasurable experience started several months before we arrived at the Harvest Inn. We had purchased a 2 night stay at a charity silent auction event last year. As we were going through our stack of gift certificates last summer, we discovered that the stay at the harvest Inn had expired! I told my wife to make a phone call to the Inn before we just threw it away. The woman she spoke to was so nice, and yes, all of their reservations are handled on property by Harvest Inn Employees! She extended our certificate for an additional time period and we were able to finally book our trip in December 2010. We have stayed and a wide variety of hotels in the valley, including most of the "Higher End" properties, and the service we encountered was as good if not better than those properties. The front desk staff were terrific and even offered us an upgrade to the room type offered with the certificate. (Keep in mind that we were cashing in a gift certificate! The hotel certainly did not have to offer us any kind of an upgrade!) Our room was spacious and clean, with beautiful views of the vineyard at the rear of the property. As my wife put it, "this room is so romantic"! The wood-burning fireplace in the room was so cool! It was huge and the design is impossible to describe. The masonry work throughout the entire property is masterful! Take a walk through the grounds and look at the brick chimneys, pillars, pathways, and walls. It will amaze you! The hotel is located about a quarter mile from downtown St. Helena (our favorite town in the valley), and you will find wonderful restaurants and wineries very close to the hotel! We had such a great time that we ended up extending an extra night. Have you ever found that one special hotel that makes you feel like family? You know, the one where you end up missing the staff after you leave? That's how we feel about this hotel! We will definitely be back, and we both hope that will be soon! Folks, stay here! You will not be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Amandabreck
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful! We stayed in a room overlooking the vineyards. The shower was very nice. If you like big bathtubs choose a different room. The bed was very comfortabel.The breakfast every morning was great, especially the quiche. The only complaint we had was that the fireplace which we used bc it was very cold made it very smoky in the room. The grounds were wonderful and the staff was very helpful. This hotel is perfectly situated to enjoy the wine country. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Denis L
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an amazing 4 night visit. We stayed in one of the King Fireplaced room. what a great room! The highlight was the custom designed fireplace which dominated thye room. Every night, the staff leaves a starter bag and several well aged hardwoods. We had a fire every night. Room was very large and bathroom was very clean and contemporary. I read some of the reviews on this site re. service quality and I must say, "i have no idea how those people felt the service was bad". Everyone at the property was incredibly friendly and helpful. On check-in, they left us a complimentary bottle of Chardonnay. When I mentioned to the service person, we enjoyed reds, he immediatley found us a bottle of the "Harvest Red". also, complimentary copy of Chris Botti CD was a nice romantic touch. Breakfast in the Country KItchen was very good, diverse, and pleasant. overlooking the Vineyards. I guess if I had to find a criticism is that the rooms were not well light (big deal).
