We will find a way to return. This place will always be special to us. Also great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra H
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous review I had to write one myself! I knew well in advance what amenities were and were not included in our room. I did my homework instead of blaming someone else. The grounds were beautiful. The room was spacious and we really enjoyed the fireplace. We also took advantage of the hot tub and complimentary breakfast. We didn't have much interaction with the staff but upon check-out they did offer to print my boarding passes - such a nice surprise! The location can't be beat - it's in the heart of the valley. The only downside to the great location is that some of the rooms are right on Hwy 29, which can be very noisy. I knew that going in so no surprises there! Overall a great place to stay and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, terrible management”
Reviews.Author: AZMrsG
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay here. Let me start with the positives...the inn is in a great location, convenient to everything in St. Helena (about 2 minutes to Press and Go Fish). The grounds are beautiful and the breakfast is very good...good coffee, oatmeal, quiche, fruit, pastries, etc. Before you get too excited, let me say that I doubt we would stay here again...read on. On to the room...we stayed in the Manor building which was located in the back of the property (which is what you want, away from the noise on Hwy 29) however, our room did not have a safe (??) or a tub and the hotel does not provide slippers. I thought this was odd considering the often cold temperatures in Napa and the price you pay for a room there (I think we paid approx $400 per night). I called and asked about the slippers and was told they don't offer them. I asked about the safes and was told only the newer rooms have them. We resorted to using our car as a safe which was easier then hauling our belongings to the front desk safes. Our room also did not have a balcony or a patio and when I asked about this I was told only half of the rooms have those. There is a big difference in the amenities you may or may not get in these rooms SO ASK! The room was very clean however the 2 glasses of wine we poured the first night (Thursday) were STILL in the room on Sunday when we checked out. Also, the complimentary bar includes 4 items - 2 water bottles, 1 orange juice and 1 Perrier. We took the 2 water bottles the first morning with us and they never replenished them. Internet - the free wifi *rarely* works. It has one bar at best and kicks you off...don't count on internet. I had 2 spa treatments here, a facial and a massage. The "spa" is a tiny, low ceilinged room upstairs from the pool where they also don't have slippers or robes or a sitting area to relax in. Each treatment was $110 and you would think you might get a few of the "normal" spa perks for this price. In fairness, the outside person, Tumi, that they hired to come in was very sweet and good. However, if you get a facial, do not expect a spa like one hour facial. This is more like a Swedish massage with a 15 minute, 5-step, very basic cleansing facial. This is fine if you don't care, but I have had many facials at many spas and this hardly qualifies. Finally, my biggest complaint with this property is their "concierge", Lisa, and the General Manager, Debbie [--]. I started emailing Lisa a month before our visit with some very specific wineries and restaurants that we wanted to go to. This is our 3rd year returning to Napa at the same time. I literally could not have made it any easier for her...I simply wanted her to make the reservations and to coordinate the stops based on location and proximity to each other. We got off to a rocky start when Lisa did not respond to TWO of my emails. I then called Justin, the assistant manager and asked for assistance. That prompted Lisa to leave me a condescending voicemail saying I must have misunderstood her but she was working on my stuff. She never even replied to me so why would I have thought that? So, she and I emailed for a few days with me doing all the work because every time she would tell me something was already booked, she did not offer any other suggestions. i still can't get over the fact that this gal is a concierge - she offered NOT ONE suggestion or idea as a replacement. Finally, I got fed up with her and called the GM, Debbie. After having a very nice conversation with her and explaining that we needed 2 wineries to fill the gaps in our itinerary and that we do NOT like the standing counter, walk up tastings but in fact LIKE the private tours, private tastings, vine to wine type of experiences, she assured me she would personally book us in to 2 great "experience" type tastings. The tastings we were booked into based on my research and request so far were Duckhorn ($35 pp for an estate tour) and Cakebread ($30 pp for a red wine tasting). Knowing ALL of this, Debbie took the liberty of "booking" us for a 3pm tasting at Freemark Abbey. We walked in and gave them our name and asked what we had been booked for - you guessed it - the $10pp standing room tasting. Just what we didn't want for our main afternoon "activity". Anyone can walk in and do this, all day long. After this experience I was highly suspect of the next mornings first appointment which Debbie also booked for us. I called the front desk and asked if they could try and get us into Far Niente or Nickel & Nickel. Lisa called me back and said neither was possible and that one of the wineries had a 28 person wait list. I woke up early the next morning and decided to take matters into my own hands. I first called Jessup Cellars, where Debbie "scheduled" us in at 10am. I asked them what we were booked for...you guessed it...the free tasting. I called Nickel & Nickel and told them how unhappy I was with the wineries my concierge was sending us to and asked if there was any way they could accommodate us on our last full day in Napa. I explained that it was my birthday, we were fans of the winery and that we were repeat visitors to Napa (not rocket science). Even with a 28 person wait list, they told us to come in at 10am and they would simply make their first group a group of 10, instead of 8. This was a one and half hour winery tour and tasting that cost $50pp and was great!! I'm still trying to figure out how I have more pull than a concierge and a general manager that live in Napa and work in the industry. Scratch head. The bottom line is that the place is well located, it is pretty, the breakfast is good but beware of the location and room type you are placed in and rely on the concierge for absolutely nothing (especially involving any input). And as far as Debbie, it's one of two things...1) either she did not care one bit about our experience or 2) she is simply clueless as to what a private tour and tasting is versus a walk up experience. Oh, I forgot to mention that we ended up walking into Jessup Cellars just to see what we "missed" since it is a few doors down from where we were booked for lunch...hmmm...it is about the farthest thing from a winery tour you could ever imagine. It isn't even on a vineyard...it is in a commercial building amongst many shops and it is nothing more than a small tasting ROOM. I understand they offer many free tasting coupons to the hotels and through the visitors center. This is fine but is NOT what we asked for, and more importantly NOT what we talked about on the phone or detailed in emails. All I can say is I am happy we didn't follow Debbie's itinerary and trusted our gut instead. Lastly, Tara at the front desk was very sweet and deserves mention as she was the only one who genuinely seemed to want to help.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing Inn”
Reviews.Author: sunshinefollower37
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during part of our honeymoon. It was fantastic! The concierge was extremely helpful and assisted in making reservations for all of our dinners. The ambiance of the Inn is extremely relaxing. Our room had a view of the vineyard which was beautiful. We had an amazing time!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with an ideal setting”
Reviews.Author: EddyEdster
Reviews.Content: We landed at the Harvest Inn on an unscheduled road trip. They were happy to find us a room with our dog. Large room and bathroom. Furnishings were basic but well maintained. We had a vineyard view with back patio - the best part. Also really enjoyed the newspaper selection and coffee in the breakfast room. Staff were friendly and even gave us a nice deal when we decided to stay another day. Perfect luxury with a dog. Plus, we love St. Helena.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: ChiTown06
Reviews.Content: Let me start by acknowledging that the Napa Valley is pricey, and most hotels in the area are going to be on the expensive side. That said, I was underwhelmed by my room at the Harvest Inn in a recent stay. We stayed in a Fountain Room on the ground floor, with a bathroom window that fronted Hwy 29. There was a small patio area in front of the room, which contained two cheapish chairs, a table and a tacky plastic ashtray. Inside, the room was fairly spacious, with a fireplace and seating area, but I could not escape a certain motel feel about the place. The furniture was a bit tired, as were the linens, and we had problems with the TV. However, the bathroom was very large and well-appointed, and we enjoyed the oversized tub. However, my husband could not get over the cheap "gas station quality" toilet paper when he was paying around $500/night. Outside of the room, the grounds were really quite beautiful, abutting a vineyard in back, with mountain views, lovely gardens with English country charm and a koi pond. There were also two pools, although we did not get a chance to make use of them. I also have good things to say about the breakfast included in the price of the room, served in a restaurant or delivered to your room for a fee. It included a wide selection of the typical continental breakfast items, but also a nice quiche, as well as other hot foods like sausage, and made-to-order lattes and espresso drinks. Overall, the room - at this price point - was enough of a turn-off that I would be reluctant to recommend this hotel to a friend, and I am not likely to return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in the Valley”
Reviews.Author: 52BoiseTraveler
Reviews.Content: We've been going to Napa for the past 20 years and loved it at the Harvest Inn. It is quiet, great service and great location. We will definitely be back next year! It is expensive but no more so than a lot of Napa Valley places.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Penallen
Reviews.Content: We travelled from the UK to get married in Napa and chose our minister who in turn arranged all accommodation and the ceremony at the Harvest Inn. Being that we had organised our elopement from so far away we were nervous about the location arrangements. All our concerns went away when we go to the Harvest Inn. The staff were friendly and professional. The grounds are spectacular - besides the most incredible bedroom window view of the vineyards, the general areas between the buildings were immaculate, well positioned and well cared for plants and flowers. The on-line photos don't do it justice. Our room exceeded our expectations, lovely clean luxury bathroom with a comfortable bed and a breathtaking view. The staff went out of their way to assist with the elopement requirements, on the day of the ceremony Lisa from reception told me to call her if I needed anything, that they were there to help in any way. In the morning I called and asked that the room be refreshed while we went out briefly so that it would be nice and presentable when my hair and makeup people arrived - as we left the room 5 minutes later the cleaning cart was pulling up outside. Special wedding arrangements aside. The pool was lovely, set in tranquil surrounds. The breakfast although continental was superior to most and I liked that they have take out cups for a second cup of coffee on your way out - a nice touch. We had a fabulous stay at the Harvest Inn and have already been recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel that captures the essence of Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: PDXcoffeetraveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay in Napa. The grounds are beautiful and quiet despite the central location. Rooms are well appointed and luxurious and came with complimentary bottles of wine. Only complaint is that I would expect a better shower head to go along with the rest of the spacious bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, fabulous location to wineries!”
Reviews.Author: sherryshoes
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Napa Valley, and the Harvest Inn was recommended by a friend. The landscaping and grounds are gorgeous. The room was clean and very nice (a bit more up to date in the newer northern section than the older rooms, from what we had heard), and the location could not have been more perfect. There are dozens of wineries all within minutes of us, as well as some great restaurants. Breakfast was included and exceeded our expectations (much more than just a simple Continental). Had great massages on site. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely THE BEST!!!!!!!!!!!1”
Reviews.Author: janesf91
Reviews.Content: Well I have to say .....I / We LOVED THE HARVEST INN!!! We got married July 3 and went here for 3 nites...then Maui!! Our stay was so wonderful and we cannot wait to go back. We stayed in a King Vineyard View Room with Firesplace....we had an awesome view of the mountains and the vineyards......The pool area and the view is all so romantic, tranquil.....peaceful......OMG!!! We are already planning to go back and want some family to come......it's great for honeymoon, couples getaway, or even a girls weekend time ! It's so nice....Even the bathrooms.....the room service was EXCELLENT.....I ordered cheese and crackers one night before going out....and it was brought to our room within 5 minutes....everyone was sooooooooo nice!!! the AM breakfast buffet was also wonderfully good. Even the town there is so nice, walking into town.....We also suggest you to go to Cindy's backstreet kitchen for dinner and the Greystone Academy Restaurant that overlooks the mountains....the food was awesome!!! Love the Harvest Inn!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Harvest Inn - a good choice in St. Helena.”
Reviews.Author: vizli
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed in Napa for a couple of days and chose the Harvest Inn for its central location. Almost all the wineries in Napa are 10-15 minutes away. The Inn itself was comfortable. The room was spacious and the pool with jacuzzi was close by. The breakfast was a continental one so it was only average if compared to some B&Bs. The view of the winery from the dining room, however, was pretty. We received a 35% discount by pre-paying so the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Knocked our socks off!”
Reviews.Author: hmp2z
Reviews.Content: We split our stay between Sonoma and Napa Valleys, and we were initially undecided as to whether to stay at the Harvest Inn or at Bardessono. We were SO happy that we went with Harvest Inn. The hotel itself is lovely; the grounds in the morning with the fog on the mountains are a sight to behold! The breakfast each morning was wonderful. We really enjoyed the delicious, flaky pastries. Paired with the view of the vineyard and the fireplace, it was incomparable. The service was wonderful, so attentive, and the rooms were large, spacious, and luxurious. We will DEFINITELY return and recommend the Harvest Inn to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel with a Great location”
Reviews.Author: vegasfoodie2009
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff. The comp breakfast way WAY beyond expectation. Very European. Staff members great with you a smile everyday. Rooms: a little dated (esp. the bathrooms) but very clean. Beds were very comfortable. We stayed is a basic double and it was HUGE. I didn't see a safe though. Great location very close to Dean & Deluca. They take very good care of the landscaping here and there quite a few gardens. Would be a great place for a wedding of about 75-80 guests.

Reviews.Title: “A magical experience”
Reviews.Author: u7mg0
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Napa every year from Florida since the early 90s. this is the first time staying here, and I am just sorry it took so long to finally do it. The room was indescribably beautiful with a deck right on the border of the vineyards. We had very high ceilings and a huge brick fireplace in our living room. The bed was so comfortable. The bathroom was gorgeous – looked like it was just redone with slate. What a feeling to wake up and view the vineyards right there at our door. The grounds of the hotel are lush with flowers and plants. A nice fountain bordered a courtyard. It was Memorial Day weekend, and the place was booked, but it never felt crowded. In the main hall, they had a piano player one night, and wineries pouring their samples on the weekend, accompanied by some nice nosh. As for breakfast, there were more than ample choices. I am amazed some others have criticized it. they had this vegetable frittata each morning which was to die for. Two pieces each morning with homemade biscuits. All this overlooking the vineyard. Many restaurants on St. Helena main street. We did Market which was great – lots of locals go there. Bottega down in Yountville is a must. Graystone has a gorgeous view, but always mediocre food. While on the pricey side (what isn’t in Napa) it is truly a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Married at Harvest Inn---memories for a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: ladeebugged
Reviews.Content: This place is an absolute dream come true! I wouldn't change a thing! Everything is perfection: the location in St. Helena (which we found to be the best place to be in Napa Valley), the stunning gardens and landscaping, the privacy created by the setup of the Inn, and the rooms themselves with breathtaking views. As soon as we pulled into the driveway of the Inn, I was smiling. The abundant flowers and charming lobby building are just so welcoming. The interior of the Great Room was lush and cozy with the giant fireplace and staff ready to serve you whatever cocktail you like. The rooms are spacious enough to make yourself right at home, although it's tough to leave when you get so comfy! I loved the way the rooms were spread out over the property to allow for privacy, but yet everything is still just a quick stroll down the path. And I don't think there is a spot on this property that isn't absolutely gorgeous to look at! The vineyard view off our room deck was...well...too lovely for words. I loved to get up in the morning and open the curtains. Oh, and our wedding----even with the cloudy weather and rainy sprinkles, we were able to have the ceremony out on the Vin Rose lawn with the vineyards as our backdrop. Talk about fabulous! The breakfast in the morning always hit the spot- with fresh baked goods from a local bakery, a couple hot items, and plenty of fresh fruit. The only problem we had with our stay was that we hardly got any sleep....we found the beds to be too firm and the feather pillows to be too flat...we barely slept a wink. But if you like that kind of thing, then you'll be in heaven! I am already wanting to go back for our 1-year anniversary! I will be recommending the Harvest Inn to all of my friends....

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful and relaxing INN....perfect for visiting Napa!”
Reviews.Author: vinotemp
Reviews.Content: From the moment when walked into the lobby, we knew this Inn was special. The staff as so attentive, helpful, and friendly. The grounds are beautiful and the Vineyard room that we had was spacious, beautifully furnished, the bed was heavenly, and the bath towels are plush and BIG! The patio outside our room looked out into the vineyard. It was beautiful and private. The breakfast that is included with the room is amazing. It is a lot more than the normal continental breakfast that is offered at some hotels. The hotel concierge, Hugh, was so helpful and accommodating to our needs. Can hardly wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in the area”
Reviews.Author: LindaB11
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in the Napa Valley. This really is the best time of year to visit -- all of the vineyards' gardens are in bloom, there are wildflowers everywhere, and the weather is fantastic. It's worth it to pay more for a vineyard view room here -- it really makes you feel like you're in the wine country and not just any old small town. The room we had was large, and the bathroom was nice, but we weren't impressed with the decor -- it seemed out-of-scale and not upscale at all...disappointing since the exterior of the buildings and the ground are just lovely -- doesn't feel like you're on the main highway, because of the lush landscaping and mature trees. One thumbs down: too tired to go out to dinner, we decided to order a meat & cheese tray from room service -- it was not good at all and way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: sjtnh
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, quiet and peaceful hotel -- encompasses all that is Napa Valley

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: WT_HI
Reviews.Content: Staying a the Harvest Inn was a wonderful experience. The beds are delightful, the views of the vineyard spectacular, and the warmth of the receptionists and bartenders remarkable. What also makes the Harvest Inn so special is the beautiful landscaping, and the hotel's central location to St. Helena and the vineyards. From a person in the hotel business - it is so refreshing to see a hotel that gets it. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but not worth $500/night!”
Reviews.Author: Nora-Ann
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a pet friendly inn and chose Harvest Inn specifically for this reason. I read the reviews, good and bad, and have to say they are pretty spot on. If you can't get a vineyard view room, I would think twice about staying here. When I checked the rates online at the inn, the lowest price quoted was $569. I got deal through Orbitz for $444/night. It seems others paid far less, but it is high season in St. Helena so for a romantic getaway I went with it. I emailed the inn directly to let them know we would be traveling with our French Bulldog. She is all of 20 lbs,, well behaved, and we bring a travel kennel with us which she happily stays in when we're out of the room for a few hours, ensuring no damage can be done. I included all of this in my email. I received a rather terse response from Lisa, the front desk supervisor, that they did not have any 'pet friendly rooms' available any longer. For my $500 + pet fee you either are pet friendly or you're not. After exchanging emails Lisa said she would contact me if a pet friendly room became available before our arrival. Now when we got there they put us in a dark room right on the highway and the highway noise is significant, despite the fair job the inn has done of putting up trees and hedges to block at least the view of cars passing by. When we returned to the front desk to ask to be replaced, voila! a vineyard view room was available for an extra $40/night. Since we were already spending well close to $1000 for the weekend stay, we figured what the heck. I did not ask if this room happened to be pet friendly because I probably would have blown a gasket and at this point had decided just to enjoy the weekend. The vineyard view is lovely, but people did pass behind on a path and I did not feel safe leaving the door open in the evening. Reading about the people who had belongings stolen made me extra careful to lock all doors and make sure I didn't leave ANY valuables in plain sight. The room was adequate with a large brick fireplace, but I can say I smelled the ash every night when I returned. If you clean a fireplace and room out properly this smell should not linger....I know this because I have a wood burning fireplace in my living room. Ah, but the bathroom. We decided it was the 2nd best shower in America...the first is at my mother's carriage house. The soaking tub was also lovely and both me and my 6' husband fit in it quite nicely. Also the robes were soft and a nice weight so we actually purchased 2 for home. Lastly we LOVE air-conditioning and the weekend was quite room; the AC did not disappoint and for this we were grateful. As you walk around the grounds are lovely and well maintained and the pool looks nice, but we didn't use it since we were there to visit vineyards. If I were going for longer than one weekend I definitely would have wanted more amenities, i.e. restaurant, room service, activities, etc. The breakfast was meager, but the coffee was quite good and they gave me real half and half when I wrote it in on the breakfast card. I can see why some reviewers complained as it's certainly not what you would expect from a true B&B/Inn. Hard, sugary pastries, sugary granola, orange juice, and organic yogurt. All in all I probably wouldn't stay again as for that price there are far nicer accommodations in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mix of Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: BEPWestCoast
Reviews.Content: Our entire stay was seamless from beginning to end. We held a three-day business meeting in the beautifully designed Fountain View room. The set up met more than our needs and the service was prompt, attentive and very courteous. Thank you, Melinda! Our rooms were a quiet, large yet cozy and peaceful, oasis away from it all. They were a perfect place to go to after a long day of meetings. The staff at the front desk was always smiling and happy to help no matter what time of day or night (thanks again to Chris for making coffee for us at 5:30 am before our morning walk!). Our group (from New York/New Jersey) was truly blown away. The property is stunning, truly, with acres and acres of lawns, redwood and pine trees and flowers of all sorts all over the place. Plus, it's located right next to all the famed restaurants and easy to reach for a night out on the town! We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Explore, uncork and relax without breaking the bank”
Reviews.Author: ditdoy
Reviews.Content: The Harvest Inn serves well a home base for sampling the miriad of excellent local wineries. Our room was large, comfortable and newly refurbished but rather plain in it's decor. It offers an above average breakfast with an outstanding view of the adjacent vinyard. The grounds are cozy and well cared for, especially around centrally located heated pool and hot tub. My only real complaint was that the room was unheated upon arrival (55 degrees) and it took a lesson in digital thermostat operation and an hour before it heated up to a reasonal comfort level. Not a great welcome after a long trip. To end on a positive note; the employees were all friendly and helpful and the buildings were artisticly fininshed in stone and brick creating the feeling of privacy and peacfullness set back off a heavily traveled Route 29.

Reviews.Title: “Great Couples' Getaway”
Reviews.Author: lovemycab
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend without the kids at the Harvest Inn. I found it online and was surprised how the pictures and reviews matched the actual Inn. The grounds were beautiful including views of the mountains and vineyards. Staff was very helpful. Location was great as it was central to nearly everything. Great place for a couples' weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to spend Xmas in wine country (w/kids and dog)”
Reviews.Author: holuko
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms (a dog-friendly deluxe king room and a double-queen room) for a family trip to wine country for Christmas. The Harvest Inn provided very pleasant accommodations. The hotel's scenery is wonderful--it backs onto a vineyard of cabernet and merlot grapes--and the rooms are spacious, if simply furnished (we stayed in the "Rose" section of the hotel). Check in: the reception area is in the main building, which formerly was used as a winemaker's club, apparently. Lots of carved wood, bricks, and "lodge-y" ambiance. It was decorated very nicely for the holidays. We encountered a problem at check-in (we were given keys to two king rooms, and had to return to get another room for the double queens), which the hotel remedied quickly if a little grumpily. There's no one to help bring your bags to your room, so be prepared to shlep bags from your car to the room. Rooms: the rooms are really spacious and offer a mini-fridge and some complimentary beverages. The decor feels a little dated, and the plumbing fixtures in both of our rooms were a little "off" (you had to turn the shower knobs several times to get the water going). For me, the worst part was the beds--they felt really old, with tired springs that were truly uncomfortable. Amenities: Though there are 2 pools on the property, the one closer to our room was out of service. The other, working pool has a hot tub and a nice view of vineyards and redwood trees. The breakfast buffet was basic but very convenient. Overall a very nice stay but somehow we felt that the Harvest Inn fell a little bit short in terms of service and quality of room for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, well-run, beautiful place from which to visit in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoValentine
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my three-day stay at this fine hotel very much! The room was very well-appointed, very clean and the service was excellent. The wood-burning fireplace was much appreciated, as was the flat-screen TV with the leather club chairs. The bathroom was very plush and there was a large closet for hanging clothes! The view off the large outside deck was very nice, yet very private. The grounds are incredibly beautiful, even in December, and the architectural detail of the brickwork on the buildings is unbelievable. I was visiting Napa Valley for a leisure wine trip and this turned out be an excellent location for doing so - St. Helena is a beautiful little town, there were several high-quality wineries (V. Sattui was great) and some very fine restaurants (Tra Vigne was a favorite) nearby. I was able to schedule an in-room massage very easily and it was highly enjoyed! This hotel also is dog-friendly and the staff was very kind to my Valentine, which really made the trip that much more special. This hotel exceeded my expectations!

Reviews.Title: “BAIT AND SWITCH!!! Stay clear of this one folks!!! BEWARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Delphis911
Reviews.Content: The ONLY reason my wife and I stayed here was because of a 30% web special (if you prepay for your stay.) The person that booked the reservation said only one night qualified and she couldn't book the nights separately so I should just prepay and then speak to the manager upon arrival, I inquired about this upon check-in and was told he would be there the next day, the next day he was unavailable again and the day we checked out I was given a number to call. After numerous attempts I spoke the gentleman and he said he would get back to me. Again, after numerous attempts, he said they were phasing out that special and he would give me a huge discount "the next time I stayed there!" Stay clear of this one folks, there are many, many places to stay in the area that are worth $300/ night, this is NOT one of them... As it turned out we were given no discount on either room and they told us there was nothing they could do...again the ONLY reason we even looked at it was the substantial discount of their "web special"... BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: CTMom4
Reviews.Content: The Harvest Inn is a truly lovely and romantic place to spend your time in the Napa Valley. Everything is exactly as pictured. Rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Bathrooms are gorgeous. Complimentary breakfast in the morning was a great way to start the day before visiting the wineries. The concierge, Hugh, was very helpful and suggested some wineries we might not have visited. Although right in the middle of a very busy road, it was serenely quiet at all times. The location made it very easy to visit several wineries. The gardens and vineyards make this a very special place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedding”
Reviews.Author: w0rld_xplorer
Reviews.Content: We were married here - and we were a little nervous for our guests after reading through all of our reviews. First, I have to say that if you are expecting reasonable and affordable from Napa Valley, you may want to look elsewhere. We live in the Bay Area and can tell you that most everything in the Napa Valley is overpriced. Secondly, we were married on a Sunday, so in comparison to the high rates of the weekend, the prices were a bit "more reasonable". With that out of the way - we LOVED the Harvest Inn. The rooms where our guests stayed (be sure to ask for Fireplace rooms - the upgrade is worth it) were all beautiful. Our rooms were the best in the entire place (a 2 story suite and a room with deck/ jacuzzi outside). The staff are all just lovely and so accommodating of every need (believe me, I was not the easiest bride in the world). The pools are very sweet. And the massages were so delicious after our wedding. This place is a little fairly land away from it all. And if you are willing to pay the prices of Napa Valley, we definitely recommend a stay here. If your search for a wedding site has not been fulfilled, consider the Harvest Inn. It is amazing for a wedding!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: jacers1
Reviews.Content: After a spur of the moment change of hotels, we were fortunate to be able to book 2 rooms at the Harvest Inn. Probably because it was a Monday and we were staying 4 nights. I was with my husband and another couple. We were fortunate the first 3 nights to have vineyard view. The room (cottages) was like having a suite. Bed comfortable, fireplace, leather club chairs to watch tv tub and separate shower stall(with one of the best shower I ever had in a hotel), beautiful patio overlooking the vineyard and mountains. I did my ratings to include our 4th night which we had to change rooms. These rooms were probably the older part. I didn't think it was outdated and it was clean but it wasn't as luxurious as the other room. Small bathroom, no separate shower, the bed wasn't as comfortable. Our second room was up a flight a stairs and sort of like an attic room with lower ceilings on one side. These rooms were near the Country Kitchen where breakfast is served (that didn't bother me) I thought the pools were very nice and clean with towels there. The breakfast was delicious especially the quiche. There is also a bar in the Reception which is open to 11pm. This hotel is right off of highway 29. You do not hear the highway noise. This hotel is a few minutes drive to the town and to many of the wineries along Highway 29. We loved our stay at Harvest Inn and since we got to experience being in Wine Country during 'harvest', we would come back during off season when it is cheaper to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the most beautiful wedding venue in Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: flyingbiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights, which was required to secure the venue for a wedding on the property. I wish we could have stayed a week, absolutely stunning. Well suited for a wedding, although max occupancy in the wedding venue itself is limited to 140. But the facilities and the grounds are phenomenal. Especially in the fall being surrounded by vineyards and hills. The staff was accommodating, well trained and helpful. The wedding coordinator, Tristen I think, could not have been more efficient and prepared. They followed through on everything and handled the wedding beautifully. The only minus would be the huge price tag on the rooms, very expensive, but would not change anything, worth the splurge. Most rooms seemed large and open, I would recommend the rooms with decks overlooking vineyard. Beautiful grounds and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Fun July 4th stay”
Reviews.Author: wulibrarian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for July 4th and the winery across the street had fireworks in the evening, along with dinner. It was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in a dirty fireplace”
Reviews.Author: loma boy
Reviews.Content: Lovely grounds, nice staff, but when it's 95+ degrees outside, one doesn't want to sleep in a room that smells like a well-used fireplace. It was toxic! The only way to compete with the smell was to sleep with the patio door open, the fan on and the A/C on high. Plus, the rooms were tired and the decor boring -- especially for the price. Even tho the rooms were large, who cares when all your clothes start to smell like fireplace ashes.

Reviews.Title: “Great combination of charm and convenience - beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: COTravelerBoulder_CO
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel before booking because it was fairly expensive and I was bothered by comments about noise, out-of-date finishings, poor service, etc. I am so glad we stayed here because all of the complaints were either overblown or just plain whiny. The Vineyard View rooms at this hotel are the perfect comination of bed & breakfast charm with hotel convenience. The view of the vineyard from the very private terraces is precisely what the person looking for a charming room in the vines could want. Some of the bathrooms have been outfitted with very modern finishings - ours wasn't - but it frankly added to the character of a french country inn smack in the middle of wine country. There was a spa on the terrace and I was concerned by one comment that it was not up to par because they are "soft-sided". These aren't blow-up bathtubs. They are perfectly comfortable hot tubs for two. Our bed was very good and the grounds for this hotel are unbelievably serene. The vineyard view rooms are largely in the old manor house (a fantasy tudor style) and other older buildings which adds to the charm immensely. The fountain-view rooms are much newer and I suppose might be seen as something from a very nice motor hotel (around a courtyard and possibly near the road). For the extra money, the vineyard is worth it. Breakfast was fantastic and each day we were able to spend a leisurely hour or so over coffee, fresh pastries, quiches, sausage, oatmeal and whatever else you might want. It wasn't a bed and breakfast style feast, but you get flexibility as to when you show up for breakfast and you get to decide what and how much you want to eat. Also, front-desk service was not just friendly, but very helpful with winery suggestions, routes, shipping and everything else you might ask for. Tara was particularly courteous and helped us decide on our plans for the days. I would stay here again. and again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, tranquil and relaxing...”
Reviews.Author: VJKirk
Reviews.Content: Four female cousins in our fifties got together for the first time in five years...what a delightful stay we had! The grounds were beautiful, the breakfast was wonderful, the young woman who checked us in was very accommodating. We had a loft suite with a balcony overlooking an expansive vineyard...lovely for coffee in the morning. We had our sleepover sipping wine in front of the burning fireplace while watching the US Open. Could not ask for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Inn”
Reviews.Author: jmmustang
Reviews.Content: The grounds were plush and beautiful. Room was large with a hugh fireplace. Only problem I had was the lighting in the bathroom. To get a lot of light you had to press a light switch that was on a motion detector, so once you were in the shower the light would go off. Had a room overlooking the pool area which with all the shrubbery, trees and flowers felt private and was very quiet. The Inn was pricier than another we stayed earlier in the week in Yountvillle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Saint Helena, wine country -- beautiful grounds!”
Reviews.Author: finfred
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Harvest Inn for a birthday occasion for my brother, who went upscale elsewhere (his birthday splurge!). My daughter had one room and we had another. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. There was complimentary wine and cheese both evenings (Friday and Saturday). The location in St. Helena is very convenient to the charming town and local wineries. The room we had was a deluxe king, with fireplace (it was in the 90's outside, so we didn't use it). The room was large, clean, although darkish. The bed was very comforting. The fridge had complimentary water and cola. The bathroom was spacious with tub/shower and two sinks, which we consider a plus. The closet was roomy and detached from the sleeping area. There was a large tv with dvd player. Breakfast was included and plentiful -- quiche, hot sausages, fruit, cereal, excellent baked goods, yogurts, juices. My daughter enjoyed her upstairs room, with a deck. There were two pools and jacuzzies on the property. There are spa/massage services available. The grounds are beautiful -- redwood trees, large lawns and roses, adjacent to a vineyard. A wedding was going on Saturday. Call the hotel directly for the best room rates. There are some great restaurants in St. Helena: Greystone on the high end; Cook and Cindy's Backstreet Kitchen were excellent in the moderate range. We definitely would stay at the Harvest Inn again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Harvest Inn a Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: voyager61
Reviews.Content: The Harvest Inn provides an inconsistent experience. Beautiful grounds, but pools that seem neglected as far as filtering. Good service when one of us was injured and needed first aid supplies, but a refusal to move us to a different room when we found were above the breakfast area (we had requested a quiet room at reservation time...we heard plenty of noise early in the morning below us, despite assurances to the contrary). Nice rooms in the newer buildings at the front of the property, but VERY dated bathrooms in the older buildings. All in all, I think you can find a more consistent and romantic experience elsewhere. This place is OK, but if you are looking for more than, try a different spot.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend to those seeking quiet and privacy, beautifully romantic grounds, large clean rooms and a good value.”
Reviews.Author: ReillyStLouisMO
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Napa Valley. I had checked into staying at other hotels that would have cost much more (Meadowood, Auberge, and Calistoga Ranch), but chose to save money and stay here. This was a wise decision since going to wineries, fabulous restaurants, hot air ballooning, and sightseeing kept us away from the hotel for most of the days. We did make time in the late afternoons to relax by the quiet pool and enjoy the wonderfully landscaped grounds. Personally, I liked that the resort is small, private, quiet, and shaded. We weren't looking for a spa or golf course, arriving after spending 5 days at Pebble Beach, so if you are seeking more on-site activities then this may not be the hotel for you. Location-wise, it is perfect -- on the southern edge of St. Helena. We had a pleasant complimentary breakfast (hot food though is limited to quiche and oatmeal). There are so many fabulous restaurants and markets close by that we didn't mind not having on-site lunch or dinner. One day, rental bikes were delivered to the hotel and we leisurely biked to nearby wineries -- very fun. We loved our first hot air balloon ride. Book through the concierge for lower price and front door pick-up. Eat at Mustard's for lunch. Take a tour to learn the fascinating history of the nearby Rubicon Estate. Our dining experience on the terrace of Auberge du Soleil was near perfection. Overall, the hotel was a very good experience offering a quiet and relaxing experience, large clean rooms, lush gardens, and a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: fourhams
Reviews.Content: Our party of six stayed at the Harvest Inn July 26-29 for a special anniversary occasion. We had booked the Vineyard View rooms on the Travelzoo promotion several months ago. We stayed in the rooms with the fireplace, but no hot tub. Very large room with sitting area, desk and king bed. The bathroom was updated and had an awesome shower. We especially loved having our own patio overlooking the vineyards. The grounds are magnificent...even Redwood trees, and although the property sits off the main road, our rooms were very secluded and private. Check in was easy, the staff and concierge, Hugh were most helpful. Breakfast is very bountiful with yummy breads, pastries, quiche, oatmeal, cereals, yogurt, granola, boiled eggs and cheeses. Four of the six of us traveling had never been to Napa before and this was a great experience for us. Thank you Harvest Inn staff for making our trip a memorable occasion!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, lovely garden”
Reviews.Author: Fincozmoz
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is spread out on several houses located in a lovely garden. All the houses are build in an old romantic style and just walking around the premises among the trees and meadows is a really romanic experience. The small pool and whirlpool was also very nice. Our room was excellent. It had lots of space, a very comfortable bed, wireless free internet, a great bathroom with two sinks and a "make-up-room". We had a half-bottle of wine in our room and complimentary sodas and water in the fridge. The service was excellent! From the friendly arrival, through the very pleasant glass of wine in the bar to the convenient check-out everything was impeccable! St Helena was a very cute little town where the wineyards and wine tastings are all around. We really recommend having dinner at Cindy's Backstreet kitchen while you're there! It was the best restaurant in our six week's trip through the US!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and romantic honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: bcoldwell
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I stayed at the Harvest Inn on recommendation of a coworker and it was just as they described. It is very quaint and quiet, and a great spot for part of our honeymoon. We had a vineyard view room on the second floor right above the breakfast room. This is the older part of the property. The only semi-complaint I can have about the place is some of the decor in our room could have used some updating. It didn't necessarlily seem old in the sense of worn, just a style I am not usually used to seeing in places I stay. It was still quite nice and having a fireplace in the room made it more romantic as well. We got the TravelZoo spring package (despite the season now being summer) which included a great rate, free wifi, complementary bottle of wine, free tastings (which we didn't take advantage of because of a lack of time and already had other places planned). The complementary breakfast is superb, and grounds are beautiful as already mentioned by many others. We did use the pool and hottub, they were both very nice and quiet when we were there in the late afternoon/early evening. Finally, the location is great as it is near so many great wineries and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at this beautiful resort.”
Reviews.Author: proudtobeanamerican
Reviews.Content: Everyone we encountered from the desk clerk to the groundskeeper were remarkably friendly and helpful. The grounds were beautifully maintained and tranquil. Very convenient location. Would recommend vineyard-view suites at the back of the property--rooms are large and comfortable and provide great views of the surrounding vineyards and nearby mountains. The added amenities (free wine tastings, internet access, upscale toiletries, separate walk-in shower, high-def TV, mini fridge with free bottled water/soft drinks, in-room bottle of wine from local winery, large breakfasts, etc.) at no additional cost were a nice surprise. You get your money's worth here.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: napa09
Reviews.Content: This was mine and my husband's first trip to wine country and staying at Harvest Inn was amazing. From the check-in (which I must say was the fastest check-in ever), to the wide open, spacious Fountain Room we stayed in with a huge fireplace and patio, we couldn't have asked for more!!! The remodeled bathrooms were very large and the shower was great. Other reviewers have mentioned the grounds and they are beautiful - nice winding paths between each set of rooms. The hot tub and pool are open 24 hours, so head out there in the evening - very peaceful, just no glasses out there, get some plastic cups from the bar! The breakfast was very good and the flavored water I must admit was awesome! Each night we came home to bottles of water on each nightstand. When they did the turndown service, they left classical music playing which was a very pleasant surprise!!!! Sophie, the very nice girl from Boston that I chatted it up with at the bar was very pleasant and gave wonderful recommendations for wines to try on site. The Whitehall half bottles were great!!!! During our stay we dined at Go Fish (awesome, get the lobster roll!), Tra Vigne (went here twice, fantastic pizza/caesar salad and the 2nd time the spaghetti and meatballs were super tasty), Bottega (Michael Ciarello's restaurant - sat on patio the lamb chops were superb!!!!), Taylor's Refresher (great burgers) and then lastly the Wine Train. All in all it was a great location, right in the middle between Napa and Sonoma. Great wineries everywhere! I would highly recommend doing the Del Dotto cave tour - we did and it was a very enlightening experience. We look forward to going back! Thanks Harvest Inn for the most wonderful time!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Rustic, peaceful!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MyrnaD24
Reviews.Content: My husband went on this trip to make-up for our Cacun trip during swine flu!! And lets say that this hotel made up for the diappointment in not going to Cancun. The hotel was beautiful, nice well kept grounds, lush trees. The room was exceptional. Nice comfy bedding, large room with fireplace, great view to the vinyards. The room has a small fridge, which fits waters and a few other things. They have free breakfast and there pastries and fresh made orange juice are pretty good.The staff was excellent. My husband and I got a massage in there outdoor gazebo, it was wonderful! The staff was friendly. The only small complaint I had was that the door keys were very senstive and easily demagnatized. So we had to go to the front desk to get new ones.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! Great location, beautiful grounds and rooms, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: LouLou630
Reviews.Content: This is such a great place! The location alone in the heart of St. Helena is great if you're visiting lots of wineries and restaurants. I like staying here much better than downtown Napa. The scenery here is so peaceful and the rooms are very spacious. The breakfast is WONDERFUL and a nice bonus to be included in the room rate. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Exquiste Grounds in the Heart of Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: shellgirl2007
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the Harvest Inn are truly wonderful. You will feel as if you entered another world. Beautiful flowers, plants, and trees abound! In the evening we pulled up some chairs in the vineyard and watched the sun go down. It was so quiet that you almost forgot other people were staying there also! The rooms were very spacious and the bed was nice and fluffy - you hardly wanted to get up in the morning. The complimentary breakfast was actually quite good - there were many options to chose from. We sat outside and had a beautiful view of the mountains in the distance. Upon checking out, the front desk attendant offered us cold bottles of water for our drive home. I thought this was a nice and unexpected touch. This Inn was hard to leave, but we already decided on our next trip to Napa Valley, this is where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great value, all you could want in the Wine country!”
Reviews.Author: GardenwithaB
Reviews.Content: This would be our first visit to the Napa valley area, and we're glad we chose the Harvest Inn - the staff was terrific, the grounds are beautiful, the rooms super - comfortable. We couldn't have been more pleased. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Simply put AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: chellandmike
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the travelzoo promotion and it blew my expectations away. The grounds are lush and simply amazing so take a nice long walk. The country breakfast was a real treat, actually a huge spread. We had a couples massage in The Redwood grove and that was such an awesome experience. Super cool place to stay. We found a hidden gem at this place for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location and view”
Reviews.Author: jkb08
Reviews.Content: This is it. This is Napa with the most gorgeous view of a vineyard and the mountains (provided you spring for the vineyard view room). The room we had was huge and gorgeous (305) with a gigantic brick fireplace, complete with wood for an evening fire, and a private spa tub on the deck with that view. Very nice modern bath. Housekeeping twice a day and they'll even deliver your breakfast (included) to your room. If you're going to splurge and take in Napa Valley, this place is absolutely incredible. The cottage style accommodations mean only a few units per building and it's all nestled in the most beautiful gardens I've seen. Go for it. You won't regret the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful place to stay. Cannot praise it enough!”
Reviews.Author: azdmf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harvest Inn for one night in early May, 2009, for my birthday. We were on a week-long visit to the Napa Valley, and changed hotels every night so that we could see lots of different places. Oh, how I wished that we had chosen to stay at the Harvest Inn for more than one night! We had a vineyard-view suite with a hot tub. The private patio where the hot tub is located is literally, oh - 20 feet away from this BEAUTIFUL vineyard, and the patio railings are surrounded by blooming rose bushes. There was a fine mist in the air, and we loved sitting in the hot tub with a bottle of wine, gazing out over the vineyard. AMAZING!! The room itself was also gorgeous - super comfy bed and nice bathroom. The only (slight) issue we had was the next morning we forgot to put out the "do not disturb" sign, and housekeeping must have knocked on our door like 5 times wanting to come in and clean the room. I was just like seriously, people - check out isn't until noon, and I'm getting every moment I can out of this beautiful room!! :) So if you go, make sure to put out the DND sign and ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “The Harvest Inn is even better in person than its pictures portray”
Reviews.Author: d_hops
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Harvest Inn to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. The travel package we purchased through Travelzoo seemed too good to be true - but I was delighted to find that this place exceeded all my expectations! We are novices at wine tastings but the concierge was quite understanding and not in the least bit patronizing as he helped us plan a number wine tastings based upon our likes, dislikes and preferences. The places he recommended were excellent. he also offered to help with dinner reservations. Our room was gorgeous: stone tiles in the bathroom; a huge soaking tub; glass shower; large vanity; updated furniture and linens in the bedroom; flat screen TV and lots of floor space. My favorite feature was the gas fireplace, which had a timer that allowed us to fall asleep while the fire was still burning. The grounds were impeccable, and fortunately for us our visit was the height of tulip and daffodil season! We enjoyed walking through the gardens and discovering the number of miniature ponds, reflecting pools and flowers of every color in full bloom. The breakfasts were amazing - lots of variety, from oatmeal to fruit to pastries to cereal, hot coffee, and a large selection of teas and juices. The dining area was very nice, and there's optional outdoor seating overlooking the vineyards. I would recommend this place to anybody who wants a quiet escape in the heart of wine country.

Reviews.Title: “very nice accommodation with generous free breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: britsprout
Reviews.Content: i got a great deal through travelzoo.com where we stayed in a fountain view king with free wine tastings for 2 people at 3 local wineries (the concierge has a list and you can pretty much choose which you want or he'll recommend them based on your tastes), and a complimentary bottle of wine. they had free wifi and a free breakfast buffet that included fresh juices (OJ, cranberry, apple), coffee, bread/muffins/croissants, cereal, oatmeal, cold cuts, cheeses, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, and fresh fruit. for a free "continental-style" breakfast, i thought it was excellent. the room itself was also very nice and spacious. the bathroom was HUGE with a floor-length mirror, big tub, and separate shower. the paint, mouldings, and stonework in the bathroom all looked like they were very recently renovated. all the furnishings were nice as well and the bed and pillows were some of the most comfortable i've ever slept in (i even emailed them to find out who made their pillows so i could buy some myself). we had also stayed at the silverado resort in napa, which we thought was really nice, but this place was even nicer. now i got this room at a greatly reduced rate ($175) so i'm not sure i would have loved it as much at full price, but if you manage to find a good deal for this place, i would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: Trontroland
Reviews.Content: Booked one night and found a little gem in the middle of Napa. This property is very well maintained and has hundreds of different kinds of plants, flowers, and trees all maintained very well. While relaxing after an nice breakfast at the Koi pond, we approached a groundskeeper with a question. He turned out to be the head groundskeeper and couldn't have been friendlier. He mentioned that every morning he offers free tours of the grounds which would make any garden/landscaping enthusiast very delighted. The other cool thing I need to mention is the pool and jacuzzi where open 24 hours, something I have never seen before at a hotel. The rooms in the "Fountain" area of the property were nice, but after touring the rest of the facillity we decided on our next visit we would pay the extra to stay in a room overlooking the vineyard.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jpal1
Reviews.Content: Great place, the grounds reminded me of a Botanical Garden. We stayed in the newer building in the front of the property which had gas fireplace and easy access the entire grounds. The over sized bathroom had a large walk in shower with natural stone tile, soaking tub, and elegant vanity. The main area of the room had a comfortable King sized bed, a sitting chair and table. The location of the hotel is the middle of Napa valley, which allows for quick access to large number of wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place”
Reviews.Author: Hsvtide
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Harvest Inn for 4 nights with my wife, while in Napa on business. Reserved a king room with fireplace. The room was very nice, with a very large, cool-looking fireplace, comfortable king bed, couch, coffee table, cradenza with small fridge and flat screen tv, lounge chair and desk. the back wall of the room was a big sliding glass door that opened into a patio with table and chairs, and chaise lounge. The bathroom was huge - large counter top with 2 sinks, tub and separate glass-enclosed shower. While the hotel is right off highway 29 - very close to downtown St. Helena, the property was extremely quiet. The only sound we heard at night were frogs. The property consists of small seperate buildings with anywhere from 2 to 6 rooms in each building. The back of the property looks out on the hotels private vineyard. Continental breakfast was served each morning in a small building on the far end of the hotel, but "continental" is downplaying the breakfast. Quiche, sliced meats, fresh fruit, several types of pastries, bagels, cereal, juices and coffee were always available each morning. The grounds are beautiful and quiet, and perfect for an early morning or late evening stroll. It is an absolutely beautiful property and we could not have enjoyed our stay more. Highly recommend The Harvest Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany2
Reviews.Content: The Harvest Inn is a great place to stay if you're visiting the Napa Valley. It's close to some great restaurants, shopping, wineries and a state park. The hotel is located on the highway, but sets back far enough where noise isn't a major problem. Just be sure to request a quiet room if you're sensitive to noise like I am. Our room had recently been rennovated and was very nice and very clean. At this time of year, the grounds of the property are in full bloom and filled with spring flowers. The pastries served at breakfast were awesome, too. My only complaint would be the lack of follow-up by members of the staff. I had asked the conceirge to make dinner reservations for us, but never heard back. After receiving our email reservation confirmation, I responded with a request for someone to follow up to find out what the status was for our dinner reservation requests, but never received a response. After three days, I went ahead and made our reservations. And lastly, I had inquired about some furniture in our room and no one ever got back to me.

Reviews.Title: “Charming St. Helena Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amznyc
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed three nights at the Harvest Inn. The room was very large, and generally quite nice - the bathrooms and decor are in need of an update, but otherwise, the room was comfortable and was very clean, and was a great value for what we paid (just under $1000 for three nights in a Vineyard View King during a relatively peak time). We had a lovely patio with a view of the vineyards, and a private spa tub that was great for use in the evenings. The grounds are very pretty; parking is very convenient; and the breakfast was really good! The location really could not have been better - it is very centrally located and close to lots of wineries and the Oakville Grocery, Dean & Deluca, etc., if you want to grab snacks. Short drive to most restaurants. Only downside (and this is not really any different for the Harvest Inn than other hotels) is that when traffic gets backed up on the main road, you can wait quite a while to turn into the hotel! Hotel site photos are accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, Best Part was the Massage at the Spa”
Reviews.Author: happylesbiancouple
Reviews.Content: I think overall we were a little disappointed in this hotel - but we came in with high expectations. First, we were hoping for an exapansive view of the vineyards - but all we got was a small dark window looking out onto a non-descript part of the walkway. The fireplace was nice and really easy to use. The bathtub was small and we couldn't get the water hot enough to our liking. The breakfast was better than other places, but not that spectacular (are we spoiled?) I wish they would have had a restaurant - we had to drive out for each meal - but the best part was the incredible Swedish massage with Heidi and Maria - we are massage nuts and we both thought our 60 minutes massages were about the best we had both had - they were wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “A quaint inn right inn, perfectly located in St. Helena”
Reviews.Author: DRAMMS
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property that is perfectly located in St. Helena. It is a very short drive to many of the major wineries and also to the heart of town. The property is pristine, beautiful landscaping. The rooms are large and equipped with nice stone fireplaces. The breakfast that comes with the room is outstanding. The huge room in the back of the lobby has a wonderful bar, fireplace and a chess game. We didn't attend the wine tasting but they have that available every day. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We needed to ship wine and they offered to have it picked up and shipped for us. Awesome place. Very romantic, private and each room is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Harvest Inn!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amccain
Reviews.Content: The most romantic room my husband and I have ever had. We stayed in the hot tub room with wood burning fire place. The hot tub is on a brick patio outside this overlooks the vineyard and mountains. YOu just take several steps down from your patio and you are in the actual vines. lovely in early December with the fall leaves on the vines The room is very large with the largest wood burning fireplace I have ever seen. Request room 203--the receptionist told me it is his favorite room upon check in and we loved it. Last nite my hubby and I had such a romantic evening by the wood burning fireplace (wood supplied free of charge by the hotel) and the jacuzzi outside. It is so private out on your patio you can easily sit out in the lounge chair or go in the hot tub in your birthday suit. The complimentary breakfast is very hearty and has a wide assortment. The lobby is so beautiful with all the wood and fireplaces. The grounds are stunning. If you are looking for a quiet, relaxing, romantic hotel with lots of unique charm then this is your bet. The hot tub room has got to be the best value in Napa Valley. The experience is truly amazing. You don't want to leave your romantic spacious room--you just want to nestle up with your honey.

Reviews.Title: “Harvest Inn was Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: hotelfan22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harvest Inn as part of a long awaited visit to California. This was the highlight hotel of our trip. Our room had a huge brick fireplace and a porch overlooking a vineyard and the mountains. It was cozy, quiet and comfortable - just perfect for a couple of days of relaxation. The sunset colors were beautiful. The concierge helped us set up two very nice winery visits and arranged a last minute dinner reservation even though it was a Friday night. The front desk agents and maids were always friendly, and the breakfast (included in the price of the room) was very tasty. All in all - a wonderfull base for a great visit to the Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: Lisa-Steve
Reviews.Content: I have been to Napa many, many times over the past 15-20 years, so I have a feel for the prices. On this visit, we decided to go "upscale" and stay at the Harvest Inn - a place I've driven by many times. The grounds are gorgeous. The general location is great - between Oakville and St. Helena on Hwy 29. The breakfast (which is included) was also very nice - great food in a very nice setting. But for $400/night, I expect more. Our room was in the older part of the complex. It was large and clean, but looked like it needed an update from the 70's. The worst part was the spa upstairs from us, where people were working starting at 7:00am in the morning - moving chairs, cleaning rooms, etc. It was NOISY! We also had problems with the internet and phones. In general, this might be a good place if you get a room in the newer section ... and a reasonable room rate.

Reviews.Title: “The Horrible Hotel That Time Forgot”
Reviews.Author: Yooveeay2
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where to begin. I'm depressed just thinking about it. On our honeymoon, we came to Harvest House from Milliken Creek (which was phenomenal) and all we wanted to do was leave. We first booked a Spa Vineyard room and were greeted with a 1970s style room with an inflatable hot tub and disgusting bath fixtures, peeling wall paper, smelly, ugly curtains, a mini fridge that looked like it came from 1977, and cheap patio furniture. For what we were paying, it was dismal. We were moved to a Fountain room which was at least updated with a new bathroom, but at the cost of being on a parking lot next to the highway. The breakfast was atrocious. It was like summer camp but worse, with fat kids sticking their hands in bowls of hard boiled eggs, extra charges for espresso and literally zero variety beyond sugary pastries. You sit at tables crowded in a room designed to look like a 1970's hickville storefront with soggy salami on plates and hokey EVERYTHING. I wanted to get out as soon as I sat down. The shower, even though updated with nice slate tiles, was horrible, too. I froze to death and the floor was covered in water. For the price, save yourself the despair. This place reminds me of something I would have liked at age 9 in the 70s. Strips of Christmas lights adorn all the brick walkways, the decor is tired, sad and ugly and ruined 2 days of our honeymoon. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the "complimentary" wine, it costs $20!!!”
Reviews.Author: sundancer61
Reviews.Content: What was supposed to be a wonderful weekend getaway turned into a stupid hassle over a $20 charge. No help from the staff and after endless phone calls and emails, I gave up. It is a beautiful place but they charge incredible prices for it and then add charges after you check out. I'd like to see this place go out of business. They ruined our weekend with their stupidity.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous grounds, wide variety in rooms”
Reviews.Author: CityChic_Hil
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as the second stop on our one-week first anniversary trip. We're both in our mid 20's and although we don't have a huge budget, we've both travelled extensively and have stayed at hotels at either end of the spectrum. We picked this hotel to be our "splurge" for the week, and stayed one night at $367 (to give you some context). I know that might not sound like much for Napa Valley, and it's really not, but it was the priciest place we stayed at all week. So I guess you could say our expectations were pretty high :-) And the grounds definately lived up to them- they are spectacular! Walking around at night was lovely, everything is just so gorgeous. The free breakfast is extensive and served in a gorgeous room with outdoor space facing the Vineyard, so you have a great view. The pools and hot tubs are also nice- we enjoyed a nice glass of wine in the hot tub at night. And the room had many nice little touches, including a complimentary half bottle of Merryvale Sauvignon Blanc and a complimentary wine tasting coupon for two at Merryvale, which turned out to be one of our favorite stops of the trip. There's also a great TV in the room, with a DVD player, and free wireless internet. All great extras! I also loved the L'Occitane bath products. The only thing that fell short was the room itself. Granted, we had the most base level room, and walking around the grounds, we passed some amazing-looking buildings (facing the Vineyards or fountain) which I'm sure had some great rooms. But ours was very basic- rough wooden floor, very basic bathroom- it kind of felt like an upscale cabin. It was also very small, but clean. I would say we definitely got our money's worth considering what things cost in St. Helena, the location was great and the staff was nice. I guess for $400 a night we just expected a bit more. If you go and don't mind spending the money, I would recommend splurging on one of the nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Harvest Inn!”
Reviews.Author: travelintuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harvest Inn for two nights for our one year wedding anniversary. We are very picky because really like a certain attention to details. Rarely can we say that we did not have some constructive criticism for the places that we stayed. The Harvest Inn has now become the exception to that rule. This place is simply lovely! Every detail in the room has been thought of. We stayed in room 416 - a Fountain King. There is a soaking tub and that is why we chose it. Everything about the bathroom, room, etc. was fantastic. Our first night we had some trouble turning the TV input to play our DVD. We called the front desk and they said they'd send someone out. Someone arrived literally in less than two minutes. It was astounding, especially given the size of the property. The rooms have DVD players, CD player with input for an MP3 player, and complimentary wireless. All room rates include complimentary breakfast. St. Helena is also a place that is not to be missed. Go Fish, the Rutherford Grill, and Martini House were all spendid places to dine. We also enjoyed the shopping only the main street. All in all this was a wonderful place to visit and we will definitely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Harvest Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Marathon_Laura
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married at the Harvest Inn in July. We stayed for 3 nights and fell in love with the property. The grounds are beautiful and the view of the vineyard is amazing. Our room had french doors that opened to the vineyard and a large brick fireplace. The room was large, clean and updated. The staff was very helpful and attentive to our needs. We had a great time and a perfect wedding day. The coordination of our wedding was flawless from start to finish and we couldn't have picked a better place to be married. We can't wait to go back and celebrate our 1st anniversary at the Harvest Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Mermaid914
Reviews.Content: I would like to say, I definately enjoyed our stay. The grounds are beautiful. The staff nice. However, this is most certainly an overpriced place. We booked a spa vineyard room, and was told that this is one of the nicer rooms. The inside of the room seemed old, and needed an update. The wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling, the carpet old. The inside of our room was an average, hotel like room (except for the brick fireplace). The view of the vineyards were very nice. For the price I'm paying, I would have liked and expected more luxury. If I came back to the area, I would not stay here again. I don't think I can spend this kind of money, and not get luxury. I'm not sure how the other rooms are. Also, breakfast was pretty decent for continental.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet place”
Reviews.Author: vadnu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Harvest Inn for 4 days. We had asked for a room with a view of the vineyards, and we got that but alas got no patio/balcony, which was a little disappointing. However the room was spacious, clean and very nice, and the view over the vineyards really made you come to rest. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Views”
Reviews.Author: Warwick1971
Reviews.Content: Stayed on our Honeymoon and booked a Vineyard view room. The room was great size clean and had fantastic views - so much so my wife and I have a wish to move somewhere with such a view. Watch out for the open fire as it can be a bit smokey. Stay with them and pay for the view def. worth it

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: schimmy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple nights in February. What a terrific place! Napa is a beautiful place so most of the hotels we stayed at were great, but this one was by far the best. The grounds were amazing and there is a vineyard directly behind the property which is directly in view when eating the included breakfast buffett. While we were there, they had a free wine tasting with Trefethen (one of our favorites) and a nice spread of cheese and snacks. Our room was clean and well equipped. We loved the room so much that instead of going out to dinner, we grabbed some food from Dean and Deluca, turned on the gas fireplace in our room and had an indoor picnic. We will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Harvest Inn for all occasions”
Reviews.Author: TexasSpirit
Reviews.Content: My boss wanted to hold and incentive meeting in Napa Valley; I knew nothing about the hotels in Napa. Because of Trip Advisor, I chose Harvest Inn in St Helena. What a wonderful place. The meeting was very successful; the staff made me a hero with my boss. This is a small boutique hotel with a wonderful conference center. We had the rooms that surrounded the Conference Center, which has a huge terrace. We owned this space, attendees did not get lost; everyone was on time for meetings. The hotel does not have a restaurant, however the caterers that the hotels use are incredible. We had casual dining and a formal awards banquet. The hotel did not miss a beat. The grounds are beautiful and well-manicured. Floral is in bloom everywhere you look. The hotel also overlooks a working vineyard. You truly know you are in wine country. While we were there a wedding was taking place overlooking the vineyard; what a beautiful and romantic place for a wedding. All of the major wineries are very nearby; the concierge was very helpful with planning an additional wine tour and transportation for 30 people. This is a must do for all small groups and for romantic get-a-ways. I can’t wait to return with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Getaway”
Reviews.Author: fotobrad
Reviews.Content: This place hardly needs more praise, but here's my 2 cents. In August my mother had a room here with a patio looking out over the vineyards. Awesome setting, but I noticed the room smelled of smoke from the huge fireplace, even though they had not had a fire. But the grounds and setting were so perfect that when it looked like my girlfriend & I could get away for a night, I went to their website and booked a King room, but didn't opt for the vineyard/fireplace room. What we got was a very nice room in the Rose building, and didn't realize until later that we had a room above us. And, the building was rather close to the very busy road running through St. Helena. But even so, the King bed was super comfortable, the bathroom enormous, and it turns out we had a smaller fireplace as well. It's a bit confusing to know for sure if the flue of the fireplace is open or not- they say it's "always open" but then instruct you to check (?) which of course is impossible unless you have a flashlight. But having said all that, it was just fabulous, you couldn't ask for a better or more romantic getaway. They must have planted thousands of tulips, it was amazing. Breakfast was very nice, the quiche was made with the best Gruyere cheese, the coffee was wonderful. All in all, despite the fact that some rooms are better than others, this place is top-notch, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not worth the price. Unprofessional attitude.”
Reviews.Author: Streichenberger
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be overrated, the amenities were not up to par with the price and the customer service was poor. The staff at the Harvest Inn was unprofessional and unwelcoming. Would never stay here again or recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent venue for a wedding!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirl78
Reviews.Content: I held my destination wedding at the Harvest Inn in late October 2007. We had a ceremony and reception of 60 guests and the venue was gorgeous...exactly what we had hoped for!
