The terrace was a beautiful backdrop for our ceremony and dinner. Rooms are very pricey, but in line with that of the area. The rooms are a little run down, but I hear they are starting to renovate. The vineyard view rooms are very spacious with a nice balcony to the vineyard, and have a wood burning fireplace ready to be used. Also a hot tub and pool on the property. Breakfast was excellent...an extensive continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy1979
Reviews.Content: After flip flopping back and forth between staying at the Harvest Inn and staying at the Napa River Inn I made a reservation at the Napa River Inn in downtown Napa. A little background on me...I'm 28, from LA, work on the business side of the entertainment industry, 24/7 stressed out and can be a bit snobby about hotels. Ok on with my review...This was to be my first time in Napa and I was looking for a nice relaxiing, peaceful escape surrounded by vineyards. Thats not at all what I found when I checked into the Napa River Inn. It was a nice enough hotel, but downtown napa is somewhat stripmall-like. Not what I pictured when I decided on the Napa Valley as a destination. So I actually got in my car and drove the 30 mins to St Helena to check out the Harvest Inn. Amazing...there are no words to describe the grounds they are simply gorgeous. I called the Napa River Inn and said something came up and I was checking out. I drove back to the Napa River Inn, got my stuff, and headed back to Harvest Inn. Some of the reviews here say they need new furniture but don't pay attention to those because they got new furniture a month ago. The staff was so helpful. They were constantly checking to see if everything was ok, offering to set up dinner reservations for New Years, on and on at every point they were there to make sure our every desire was met. Our room looked out onto the vineyards from our HUGE patio deck. All you can see is vineyards and in the distance there are mountains. The room was so cute with Dean and Deluca snacks, L'occitane bath products, VERY nice thick towels, and the beds were great. I have a lot of trouble sleeping through the night even in my own bed, but had a great nights sleep each of the 4 nights I was there. This place is beyond romantic with its gorgeous setting, beautiful landscaping, huge fireplaces, breakfast delivered in bed ($5 charge), and wine/cheese tasting in the lounge of the lobby which has a HUGE fireplace. I passed a lot of hotels on highway 29 and in general while exploring the Napa Valley but none of them came anywhere near the Harvest Inn. I will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “a great evening away!”
Reviews.Author: minerva-x
Reviews.Content: We had a fireplace king fountain room and it was nearly perfect, the room was large, the staff was gracious, and we even took advantage of the pool and hot tub. The only caveat is that it was alittle pricey, but for the location, beautiful grounds, and large private room it was definately worth it. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Area at it's Best...”
Reviews.Author: Love2TrvlMM
Reviews.Content: The Harvest Inn is a very well kept Inn sitting right on the edge of a field of vineyards. The vineyard facing lanai's are lined with roses and an elegant view. The brick work on this property is very extensive and follows you into your suite with an oversized redbrick fireplace ready for a romantic evening. The entire property is surrounded by gardens and little hideaways with love seats. Some units come with jacuzzi on the lanai. We stayed here during harvest season and really enjoyed everything the Inn and surrounding area had to offer. The breakfast the inn serves every morning is loaded with plenty of healthy choices. We stayed here for 3 nights and took a 4 hour limo wine tasting tour and came back with a dozen bottles from 6 different vineyards. There is a wide choice of eateries within 20 minutes north and south of the Inn as well as a dinner train. The rooms are very well furnished and so cozy with the fireplace that it makes this the only place we will ever stay in the Napa area.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Harvest Inn”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pro55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harvest Inn for a two-day meeting and, as this was arranged by others, wasn't expecting much. It was, after all, a business meeting. I was VERY pleasantly surprised! Don't let the quaint, rustic name fool you. The Harvest Inn is a modern, up-to-date hotel abutting a vineyard (is there any other kind in the Napa Valley?). The rooms are generously sized, have gas fireplaces, a desk for working, a CD player with a CD (mine was Chris Botti's "To Love Again -- The Duets"; standards redone by contemporary musicians) a patio or porch, huge bathrooms with luxury amenities. The gift shop even sells the soaps they have in the rooms if you'd like to take some home. Breakfast was included and was quite satisfactory. While not a "full breakfast," there was a generous assortment of pastries and other goodies plus freshly-baked quiche, juices, and more. It's also close to many of the Napa wineries, though I prefer Sonoma Valley, Alexander Valley, or Anderson Valley wineries as they're less touristy, the wines are better, and they often don't charge for tastings -- a nasty practice that has become ubiquitous in the Napa Valley. But that's another story.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but needs updating...”
Reviews.Author: Sasco
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience at this hotel, but for the price, some updating of the furnishings is in order (we were in the Rose Building). Gorgeous grounds and nice breakfast room with good complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time at the Harvest Inn”
Reviews.Author: aigecko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harvest Inn in October during the height of the harvest and wine making season. I booked the Napa Confidential Package. It includes a Vineyard Room for 2 nights, Winery tour from Magnum Tours, a nice bottle of champaign, flowers, robes and a couples massage for $1699. I think it was a very good value. The winery tour was great. Going to the small wineries and meeting the owners was a treat. Magnum Tours is highly recommended. The massage was ok, not the best or the worst I have ever had. That said the setting was wonderful. The hotel and grounds were great. The rooms were big and rustic. The bathroom could really stand to be updated. The tub shower combo wasn't the greatest. Breakfast was nice, they had pastries, fresh fruit salad, quiche and sausages each morning. Plenty for me since I am not much of a breakfast eater. Check in was uneventful. The service was very good. We got everything we asked for and then some. They even made our dinner arrangements for us. Overall we had a wonderful time and I would stay at the Harvest inn the next time we are in St Helena.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: D_from_TX
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few days after Christmas and paid around $350 per night for a vineyard room because I wanted to be away from the highway noise that some rooms are near. People kept asking us where we were staying and when told they would exclaim "Oh, that place is so beautiful! You're so lucky!" Are you kidding me? The grounds are nice, but I agree with another reviewer who called the rooms rustic. Our room was big, old and cold, and the thermostat was rigged so that if you turned up the heat, it automatically reset within a half hour. I had envisioned a cozy fireplace, however you had to make a special request to obtain real wood, and the configuration of the fireplace gave off no heat. They had a huge screen in front of it that we moved for a little while but that only improved things a little. Before I booked my room, I called to ask if they had DVD players so I could bring some movies with me, but I was told that only the new units by the highway had them. I figured it wouldn't matter much because our room would at least have movies on-demand like nearly every other hotel in the country, but I was wrong. Instead, the TV had a built-in VCR and there was a brand new DVD player in the room that I wish they had told me about. I figured that they've had the VCR's a long time, and now they have the DVD players, so the hotel must have a small movie library. They didn't and were entirely surprised by the question which is just plain stupid. It rained our first day and night so that's why a movie seemed like a great idea and I can't imagine I'm the first person to ever ask. All hotel mini-fridges are a rip-off, but the ones that burn me the most are those with the tiny glass bottles of soda so you get the least for your money, and of course that's what they had here. For the room prices, they could at least sell you a can for the $2.50. The free breakfast was mostly cereal and a number of bland looking pastries. It's provided until 11am, they put out the food and you serve yourself. By 9:15 any hot food except sausage links was gone and not replaced while we were there. From the empty pie plate, I guess it had been one quiche and maybe nothing else. We did not drink at the hotel's wine bar, but I glanced at the menu and it looked like the cheapeast glass was $12, which is higher than most restaurants charge except for very high quality wines. The one and only reason to stay at this hotel is for the vineyard and mountain views, which are lovely, BUT be careful that you get a room in the actual vineyard buildings. Ours was in a different building and although it had the view, there were two large trees blocking it. One of them had lost its leaves so we could see enough through it, but I would not have accepted it if everything were in bloom, and certainly not for the higher summer rates which people told me can be $600. This hotel is never worth that price. There was just nothing else special about it and no sense that it was being run by anyone who cares. One final disappointment is that my husband got sick the morning we had to leave for the airport and we still needed to ship a few items home, so he asked the hotel if we could pay for them to ship it for us. They said yes, but I just received the package and there was no care taken with our items and some are broken. They simply piled them in a box and crumpled a few pages of newspaper. We took a risk in not packing it ourselves, but if they didn't want to handle it then they should have said so. There was no chance that the items would arrive safely, and they knew it and didn't care. Apparently they aren't concerned with getting repeat customers, and believe me they won't.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth $400 a night”
Reviews.Author: MN_Traveler1
Reviews.Content: Its a nice place, but for $400 (even in Napa) I expect something pretty awesome...and this was nice, with some nice touches, but I was expecting more. For example, the grounds need updating, and the bed linens weren't that smooth. The thing is that it was $400 RUSTIC nice, not $400 luxurious nice. The difference between it and a $170 Marriott room is just not that apparent.

Reviews.Title: “Fairytale Come True!!!”
Reviews.Author: CarlosCafe
Reviews.Content: This was the most beautiful hotel that I have ever been to. The premises were immaculate. The senary was awesome. The rooms were quaint and relaxing. The ambiance was wonderful. The staff was so polite and extremely accommadating. I did not want to leave. The premises were surrounded by green grass, beautiful trees,and magnificently detailed architectural designs. All rooms had beautiful views. It may be a little pricey but here you definitely get what you pay for and much much more!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelinglawyer
Reviews.Content: Harvest Inn is an excellent choice for a nice getaway to Napa Valley. I recently purchased the Confidential Package and was extremely pleased. Although expensive, its hard to find a place of that quality for any less. Our tour was through Magnum Tours and was absolutely worth every penny of the trip. If you want to see the real Napa Valley and not the "manufacturers" of wine (aka Mondavi, Beringer, etc) you must book them for a tour. The rooms were very nice and our view onto the vineyard was just awesome. The breakfast was very nice and having it delivered to your room to eat on the patio is a great experience. The service was impeccable and I have no complaints. I just can't see what others are talking about when they complain about the service. The gardens and grounds of the Inn are just breathtaking. If you complain about that, you're crazy. Just gorgeous. My negatives would only be the following: The bathrooms were small and did not fit with the overall beauty of the Inn. The price of the room should have included a hot tub at least. Also, be warned that the spa services are contracted out from an independent dealer and quite frankly leaves much to be desired. But a massage in the Redwood Grove is a good experience and came with the package. Otherwise, I would not have wanted to pay that much for the quality of the massage. Overall, very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Need Updating....”
Reviews.Author: atwunder
Reviews.Content: Great Location near everything in the wine country. We were here for a wedding that was perfect, however the noise at 6am from the garbage collection was a rude surprise. Do not stay Thursday evening as you will be startled early Friday. The rooms were very clean but out of date. I have stayed at many hotels for $400 per night, but this place was overpriced and it underwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: eurokitten
Reviews.Content: My three friends and I stayed at this hotel for an extended weekend on a "girls" reunion weekend. Overall, our stay was pleasant and relaxing. The location is excellent; a lot of wineries are within easy cycling distance or a short drive. We liked the rooms, although as other reviewers have said, the rooms with fireplaces sometimes retain a smoky smell when you arrive and the lighting isn't particularly appealing. But ours were large, clean and comfortable and each had a private deck. It's worth asking for a room away from the highway; I could see that it would be noisy. The staff was friendly, although not universally knowledgeable; they were all very young, and seemed afraid to make recommendations. We asked them what wineries they'd recommend and the response was "they're all good." We would have preferred some more direction as it was the first trip to Napa for most of us, and I hadn't been there in years, and tthere are dozens of wineries in the vicinity. The "spa" doesn't really exist. They have a space where therapists can do massages; if you want one, book it when you book your room. We were there for four days, but that apparently wasn't enough lead time to arrange for anything during our stay. To be fair, we overlapped with a large wedding party on the weekend, so they had booked out services. But we were surprised that nothing could be arranged for any time on Monday or early Tuesday when we asked about it upon check-in on Saturday. The wedding also meant had to change rooms after the first night as the rooms we wanted (vineyard views) were not available. Our first rooms were in #133, one of the older king rooms. It had a private deck with nice landscaping; it felt very private. It was chilly, so the fireplace was very nice. It was very quiet. The next night, we shifted to ground-floor vineyard view rooms. These were GREAT. The views were lovely, they were spacious and each had a private deck. Our rooms were #310 and #311; any rooms in this part of the hotel are worth requesting rooms as they are far away the best ones; they're also away from Highway 29 and very quiet. I thought the bathrooms were fine, just a little dated. But the quality of the linens was superb, the robes were great and the L'occitane products a nice touch. As everyone has said, the grounds are lovely; this would be a great place for a small wedding. We saw a wedding setup, and it was lovely. The breakfast was good, if unimaginative. I wish they would alter the options from one day to another, though. We were there several days, and after day three, we were pretty tired of seeing exactly the same quiche and sausages. Overall, I thought it was pretty expensive, but Napa hotels tend to be pricey. If possible, I'd suggest going to Napa during the week; there's a significant price difference in hotel rates. We stayed Saturday through Tuesday evening. The whole experience was vastly more appealing on Monday and Tuesday -less traffic, less crowded tasting rooms and we had an easier time getting into restaurants. Side note - I visited the wine country in California a few years ago. I was surprised to find that virtually all the wineries charge for tastings now. Some are quite expensive. ($10 a tasting). We tried just getting two tastings for four of us and we were told that we couldn't do that at a couple of wineries; if we wanted to taste, we ALL had to get a tasting. We also went to St. Supery, where we ended up buying $200 worth of wine, but they woudln't give us credit for the $40 we spent on our tastings (which they promised). I would have genuinely appreciated more help from the hotel to direct us to the few places that don't charge for tastings. We stumbled on a couple during our last day there. I'd recommend this hotel, especially as a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty nice place, but...”
Reviews.Author: WanderingPencil
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in late September, while on a wine-tasting vacation to Napa and Sonoma. The central location was excellent for our tours to the surrounding wineries. Our cottage-like room was large and appeared clean and well-maintained. The bathroom, like the room itself, was just a little dated looking and it took what seemed like forever to get hot water each morning when trying to shower.The bed was comfortable, but not a pillow-top like many premium hotels are now installing in their rooms. The room was furnished in a style I would call "eclectic", with a combination of old, antique and new furniture, adding to the rustic country feel. One corner of the room was occupied by a large brick fireplace. Unfortunately, the fireplace must have coughed out smoke during previous guest's visits, as the room had a strong smokey odor. Opening the french doors onto the patio, surrounded by large bushes near the pool, helped clear out some of the smell, and we eventually grew used to it. Walking through the gardens to the complimentary continental breakfast each morning was enjoyable and the nicely landscaped grounds in general were beautiful. I'd have to say that while it was a pretty nice place and we enjoyed our stay there, I would consider it a premium-priced hotel and I expected more for the money. A side note--we ate at the new restaurant "Go Fish" in St. Helena on the fourth night it had been opened and had a great meal of sushi, sashimi and salads! We also enjoyed our meals at Cindy's Backstreet Inn and Tra Vigne, although the service at Tra Vigne was slow that evening...

Reviews.Title: “Awful! Would not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: lbfreedman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for my cousin's wedding. He was married on the property. Our room cost over $400 a night and it was so not worth the money. The rooms are decorated like cheap motels, are very dark and dingy, and the bathrooms are old. The website is very misleading about the rooms. When we checked in, we immediately called the front desk bc we were unhappy with the room and believed that the room we got was not what we paid for or reserved. Our room was located in the spa and we had a view of nothing. In fact, we couldn't even open the drapes (to let in some light) bc our window led to the spa door where traffic was coming in and out. In addition, our ceiling was slanted and my husband is tall and had to duck to walk to the bathroom. They told us there was nothing they could do to change our room bc the hotel was fully booked. Interestingly, my grandmother, who checked in the following day, miraculously got a free upgrade. The next morning we found cobwebs in our shower and realized that the coffee maker had not been cleaned. We again called the desk to complain, and they again told us sorry, there is nothing we can do except have someone clean the shower and coffee maker immediately. When we returned to the hotel in the afternoon, after a lovely day of wine tasting, we asked for a manager. He told us that there was nothing he could do but that a complimentary bottle of wine was sent to our room that day as an "apology." When we got to the room, there was no bottle of wine (not that we even wanted it anyway). I again contacted the manager to let him know that there was no bottle of wine, despite his promise, and we again told him we wanted soemthing done about the situation. We asked for a reduction in price, to which he flatly replied "no." He honestly didn't seem to care about how disappointed or unhappy we were with the accommodations. If all of this is not bad enough, the hotel also screwed up the wedding plans. The wedding was basically a cocktail party with passed and stationary finger foods. I will say that the grounds are beautiful, but they ran out of food at the wedding - within 20-30 minutes - which is inexcusable. We were all starving afterwards and went out for dinner. I would never recommend this place to anyone. The rooms were awful and the service was even worse, and it was way overpriced for what they offer.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay in Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: jjfrenz
Reviews.Content: The Harvest Inn is in a good location in wine country - near many wineries and restaurants. Our room, a king suite with vineyard view was huge and clean. We had an excellent view of a beautiful vineyard from the living room and bedroom. In front of our building (the Manor Rooms) were wonderful gardens and curvy brick paths leading to the main lodge, the parking lot, the swimming pools etc. The landscape and decor of the room felt very "English Country" to me - handpainted floral tile in the bathroom, floral fabrics etc. (It's not how I would choose to decorate my interior at home, but it seemed appropriate in wine country.) The bathrooms were very clean with L'Occitane soaps, plenty of plush towels, and clean, soft robes. The bed was comfortable and had down pillows and comforter. We visited the hot tub late at night after dinner and it was spotless and hot! It felt so good after a long day visisting wineries. The conceirge dropped the ball when I had called ahead to have her make some wine tasting reservations for me. It took me two days to reach her and then, after our initial conversation, I never heard back from her. I made my own reservations at the wineries that require them (not all that many require reservations). I had also requested help with dinner reservations but got no response back. My husband and I had to go to a couple of restaurants before we could find an open table. Lucky for us it was an excellent dinner on an outdoor patio at Tra Vigne. We had an wonderful meal there!!! By the way, we heard no noise...no cars, not other guests. Our room was quiet, as was the pool and hot tub area at 10 pm at night. Our experience was peaceful. Overall, the quality is not what you would get for the same price in San Francisco or Minneapolis, but I thought all of the Napa hotels to be expensive for what you get. The Harvest Inn was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View... But the noisiest Hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ronb6
Reviews.Content: Our first night was in a nice room on the second floor overlooking the vineyard. It was actually tough to see the vines due to the fact that the shrubbery was overgrown. At 6:00 AM the next morning we were awaken to the realization that our room was directly above the Breakfast Room. There was no point in trying to go back to sleep. We asked to be moved. They moved us to another lovely room on the first floor, right on the vineyard with a nice view. Upon returning to our room that night after dinner we realized we were right below an outrageously loud and obnoxious party. After many calls to the front desk, at 2:00 AM we finally gave up. The front desk did nothing to correct or to remedy the problem. In addition to the noise from within, the hotel is located on highway 29 which is extremely busy and bordered by another busy sidestreet. Plenty of additional road noise. We had a King Vineyard View room which with tax was about $600 per night. For that, you can do alot better somewhere else in the Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect two night stay”
Reviews.Author: The_Stepfords
Reviews.Content: We booked through the hotel website and got a great deal (compared to published rates) of $209 per night. We had one of the new rooms set around a fountain with a balcony overlooking a courtyard. The room was very big and stylishly decorated (large flat TV screen hung on the wall above a really nice fireplace) - the bathroom was huge with a tub for two and a separate shower for two with L'Occitane products. Breakfast was buffet-style with plenty of choice of fresh baked goods together with fresh fruit, yogurt etc. There are two outdoor pools with ample, comfortable sunbeds - perfect for relaxation after visiting the wineries. We would definitely recommend this hotel although after reading other reviews ask for one of the new rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Skip It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back! Spent 2 nights here and 2 nights at the Villagio Inn and Spa in Yountville. The Villagio was first so this place had alot to live up to. We were on vacation with another couple and each had our own rooms. Let me first say I don't like the decor of this place and probably shouldn't have stayed here. Having said that it was ok at best. We were upgraded to an executive sweet and who doesn't appreciate that. Room was 2 stories and filled with all the problems you have making a bedroom in the attic with a bathroom. It had charm and character but for the price I expected more. The View from the balcony of our room was Wonderful! Right in the vineyard that is for sure. Nice grounds assuming you want to walk through a wedding reception on the way to your room everytime. Our friends had some problems however. When we got to their room it really smelled like fireplace smoke. More like burned out building smoke. They called and someone came and sprayed something to make it smell better. MY MAIN PROBLEM with this place happened to my friends who returned in the afternoon at 3pm after being gone for more than 6 hours to find that their room had not been cleaned. Oh they started but then closed the front door and left without making the bed, cleaning bathroom etc. Did you notice I said Front door. Yes the door leading out to their porch with a view was left wide open and yes it is on the ground floor. I'm horrified just thinking about it. Noone was around either. It's not like the staff went next door for a minute. Bottom line this is NOT a first Class hotel. Will never stay here again. Villagio blew them out of the water in every way. Same price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. It offers nice cottage rooms that are very large and beautifully decorated. I felt that I had plenty of privacy and the grounds were lovely. There were flowers and fountains and small ponds throughout. You can also get rooms that look out into their working vineyard. This is not the traditional hotel at all, I would think of it as a place where small cottages are scattered thoughout the grounds. You will receive a complimentary half bottle of wine and they offer in room massages, etc. The breakfast was included and very nice, it included most everything I would want for breakfast: bagels, eggs, coffee cakes, muffins and on and on! The people were a bit stuffy and quiet, but you can take your food and eat on the outside patio looking into the vineyard if you'd like. I didn't notice that I was bothered by too much noise. I heard some people in the morning for 10 minutes, but that was around 9 am. I got a nice nights sleep. I guess it was a bit pricey, but St. Helena is that way! For a lovely wine country experience, I would definitely stay here for a night, we paid $269, from their website.

Reviews.Title: “Harvest Inn so out of date”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was very pretty, but it was outdated. The room was big but very dark and was just one large room when you walked in. (and it smelled like fireplace smoke) The bedroom area had no privacy. It was VERY old, great if you were a senior traveller. There are other more current places and I would definitely seek them out rather than overpaying for this type of lodging.

Reviews.Title: “The Harvest Inn, the place to stay in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Harvest Inn in St. Helena and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms are spacious, well appointed and comfortable. And what could be better than sitting on your deck, which overlooks a vineyard, and drinking a nice glass of Napa Valley wine while you watch the sun setting over the foothills. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained and the service was wonderful. We've stayed at several Inns in Napa Valley but the Harvest Inn is now on our must stay list. It is centrally located to wineries and several great restaurants. I highly recommend staying at the Harvest Inn

Reviews.Title: “Harvst Inn Not so Hot!”
Reviews.Author: lepponestein
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our anniversary celebration at the Harvest Inn. Our impression was the the staff was absolutely wonderful, professional and accomodating. However, for the money this place is a rip off. The rooms afforded very limited privacy; you could hear people from other rooms and on the grounds during the late hours of the evening. The pool has no umbrellas for shade and there is no service to get a drink or any kind of snack. There were several other small things one would expect when spending this kind of money and they too were missing. We did hear from another disappointed guest that there was recently an ownership change. Apparently, they have been going for several years and were disappointed by the prices this time. They said they would not be back either. We felt that while the grounds are very pretty and the staff is certainly nice, this place asks an extremely inflated price for what they deliver. We have no plans to stay here again and are certain that there are plenty of other places in the area that afford a better experience for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Guests for life”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are on our way to the Harvest Inn for the fourth time (2nd time this year), and this time we're bringing guests. Obviously, we're hooked. The staff is, by far, the most courteous, attentive, warm group of people we've ever encountered during any hotel stay. The gardens, trees, and brickwork on the grounds take you to another world entirely. The brick fireplaces in the rooms are amazing. When we were looking for a romantic getaway, we didn't want a pretentious luxury chain hotel at which you almost pay for an additional night by the time you're done tipping for valet (on top of nightly parking fees), doorman, bellboy, room service, etc. We feel that, although it's a splurge for us, the rates at the Harvest Inn are highly competitive within the Napa Valley. The concierge is top notch and well educated in all things wine country. The rooms are romantic and inviting. The grounds are entirely charming. And, of course, IF you decide to leave the property during your stay, I understand there are a lot of vineyards around!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Napa Valley Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Gruntled_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Great vacation getaway to the wine country. Outstanding Horticulture and land scaping. Nice spacious guestroom cottages. Generous continental breakfast and best of all - the swimming pools are open 24 hours!

Reviews.Title: “Harvest Inn: Drink-a-lotta vino before you stay here-o”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before I comment, I must say the staff was amazing at the Harvest Inn, but besides that beware before you choose this establishment if you are looking for a romantic, quiet getaway. Story time of our stay: Not only was there a wedding party, and I mean party, upstairs from our room, there was a gentleman taking photos of the vineyard (and god knows what else) outside of our privée porch. Finally I had to ask him, "will you be done taking photographs anytime soon?" As though that wasn't made obvious by our long stares. All romanticism went out the door on this trip. And it broke my heart. We had previously made this our "anniversary trip," but now we are going to rethink ever coming here again. Hopefully this was only a fluke, but be warned and if you are getting one of the premium rooms... check for wedding schedules and women with high heels on upstair rooms. Not a good combo if you are wondering at 2am. And don't think after the staff notified our "buddies upstairs" of our displeasure with their behavior that they didn't try to confront us. Uggh. Give us our money back and let's get out of here. They didn't have any other available rooms so we were stuck as we had plans the following morning. And thank goodness that was an amazing day to save our trip experience! Decor, rooms, ammenities: "The Poet": nice room. View to vineyard (minus the photographer). Spa off porch. Gardens are gorgeous; as are the koi ponds. Masseuse is a wonderful man. Breakfast is great and in a beautiful room (watch out if you are over 6 ft... low lying lamps). CHANGE out the shower heads for the love of god! WE our paying a hefty price to stay here and it is definitely not to have a 10 dollar shower head! C'mon people change out the dead light bulbs. Unworkable fan in the living area. Final comment: I expected professionalism, relatively quiet rooms and a great staff. I got one of them … and it was the staff. Once the situation was brought to them they acted fast and did what they could to notify the "wedding co-ordinator." We don't typically bust our pocket books for lodging too often... and this one was definitely a lack-luster stay. Perhaps we should stick to our October "mid-week visits," because the difference in the crowds: "june party go-ers" VS. "the october quiet nights mid-week".. are night and day. Please take note. But whatever our future Napa/St. Helena trip involves, it will not be at this hotel. So much for that baby in nine months, thanks Harvest Inn guests.
